name: Basic Dog Meme
description:
The very first meme on Base and an early pioneer of the MemeFi. Base's $DOG was quite likely, according to on-chain evidence, the very first community project deployed on the network: deployed on July 13, 2023, mere hours after Base was opened up to developers.

Basic Dog Meme's initial mission was to onboard users to the nascent network by offering a "Just for Fun" airdrop to anyone that bridged ETH to base and requested some $DOG. Over 1000 addresses were confirmed to have onboarded ETH to Base in the first 48 hours of the networks public launch, all in order to receive a Basic Dog Meme airdrop. This activity provided the substantial bulk of newly active wallets on the first day.

Since then, Basic Dog Meme has:
- Assisted Aerodrome's team with finding the correct metrics and guidelines for meme coins to be onboarded to their platform.
- Pioneered MemeFi by being the first Meme coin with a gauge on Aerodrome. 
- Endlessly evangelized the benefits of meme coins utilizing Aerodrome, Base's liquidity hub. Initially it took some time to get the other Meme's on-board, but eventually it became standard practice to take advantage of Aerodrome's flywheel. All because of Basic Dog Meme.
- Rallied a community of thousands of enthusiasts, from diverse block chains and backgrounds, to bridge to Base.
- Become an ambassador of the arts by being a patron to dozens of NFT artists who love the color blue
- Was the focus of one of the first community initiatives to create a meme-coin driven L3 on Base, perhaps serving as the originator of that idea within the base community. Although Basic Meme Chain is still in the development phase, the idea that was later executed and expanded upon by multiple other meme coin communities. The explosion of meme-chains on Base happened mere days after we shared the idea with the world on twitter.

name: Be Part Of Art
description:
In a time where the world is divided, I feel it is time to build projects that connect. In a time where everyone is focusing on themselves, I feel it is time to build projects that focus on collaboration. 

Be Part Of Art is a one of a kind art project. It is a blank infinite art canvas that invites graphic artists from around the world to contribute and collaborate with each other to create something that has never been done before. An artwork that is never finished, an artwork that is always growing into something bigger. An artwork that evolves as time goes by. 

I imagine it as a digital "cave painting"... A place where you can see art, the artists and life merge into something that will be forever available to mankind.

Do you have what it takes to Be Part Of Art? 

In this first stage of the project I'd like to do a bit more research about the technical requirements and technical feasibility of the project. Find the initial group of artists to create the first piece and spend time planning the next phases. 

I'd like to spend some time brainstorming with different artists to see how they feel about the project and if they would want to collaborate. Since this all takes time I'd like to request an initial capital to cover the costs so I can focus on this project and the research full-time.

name: Bitsave Protocol
description:
WHAT IS BITSAVE?
Bitsave is a savings protocol that helps users save and earn in cryptocurrency without losing their savings due to market volatility.

BITSAVE SOLUTION (simplified)
- Bitsave helps web2 users in African Countries escape inflation in their fiat currencies by saving in dollars.
- The dollar is not easily accessible to the average African.
- Bitsave helps users create an automatic recurring savings plan

We've seen newbies lose their savings like school fees, house rent, college funds etc to Crypto, we understand that people hear about crypto and want to rush in immediately.

With Bitsave, newbies and oldies can protect their funds from market volatility, while still earning interest in crypto, a protocol that works based on maths and economic formulas to set rates and interests.

name: Blabberix
description:
Hello, I am glad to have the opportunity to tell you about our project and I am sure that we will become a worthy participant of the Websummit conference, as Politico said - the world's premier tech conference.

When I noticed that the capabilities of neural networks and existing technologies allow us to generate content that is not inferior in quality to content created by real bloggers, I realized that this will change the principles of social networks. For example, the Danish Institute for Future Studies predicts that in 6 years 99% of the content on the Internet will be created not by humans but by artificial intelligence.

So thats why, since the end of 2023, my team and I have been creating a unique project - the BLABBERIX social network, which today has no analogues not only in the form of a working product, but even at the stage of a published idea. Our project combines blockchain technology, tokenomics and neural networks.

And we decided to create not just a new social network, but the FIRST social network in Web3 with deep integration of neural networks. All the problems of projects that had been created before Hal Finney got his first 10 bitcoins in 2009 and that are working on outdated patterns will be solved by us at BLABBERIX using artificial intelligence and smart contracts.

So, to summarize, what will BLABBERIX offer to users?
-Creation and customization of virtual bloggers (virtual influencers) to suit your interests
-Decentralization at its best
-Control over your data and content
-The ability to monetize your activity on social networks and the ability to be part of large advertising campaigns
-Personalization of recommendations and content using neural networks


We have already received positive feedback on our project and an invitation to one of the largest tech events in the world, Slush, in Helsinki this November, as well as invitations to the Blockchain-Life and Expand North Star conferences in Dubai.

name: Blob Farm
description:
Blob.Farm is an idle clicker DEFI game, in which users buy Blobs which produce daily GOO. 
Goo can be hatched into more Blobs or sold into the vault for ETH.

Daily Quests allows users to collect 100% onchain NFT artifacts, burn Blobs for $JELLY token, an in-game resource for the Blob Adventure tasks and create their own custom 100% onchain PFP.

Everything is 100% on-chain (Even the adventure items and pfps images). 

Blob Farm is actively being developed by ElonsDev, and currently boasts 6 smart contracts on the Base Blockchain. 

Contract #1:  Blob.Farm (Buying & Hatching Blobs, Selling Goo)
Contract #2: Blob Adventure (Go into the mines and Find an Onchain NFT artifact daily)
Contract #3: $JELLY Token (Can be aquired by burning Blobs) 
Contract #4: Blob Defect Quest (Can Burn Blobs for $JELLY 1:1) 
Contract #5: Blob PFPs (Burn $JELLY to create your own onchain Blob PFP NFT)
Contract #6: Token Locker (Was used to lock $JELLY for future quests, dev, promos)

name: blob-archiver-rs
description:
Blob-archiver-rs is a Rust-based service crafted for archiving and querying all historical blobs from the beacon chain. It executes the functionality outlined in the beacon-archiver service documentation available at (https://docs.optimism.io/builders/node-operators/management/blobs#configure-a-blob-archiver-archive-nodes). The service is designed to listen to the Beacon chain, automatically archive Blobs, and provides the capability for manual re-archiving through command-line input. It currently supports both local file storage and AWS S3. Additionally, the query API is designed to align consistently with the Beacon chain blob API.

We are OptimismJ who continue to build open source public goods to help the Ethereum and Optimism community get better and better. Our main work is on OP Stack core protocols and ecosystem tools and libraries. You can view more detailed information on our official website https://optimism-java.github.io .

name: Blobs Guru
description: Blobs.Guru is a data availability (DA) analytics platform designed to provide real-time insights into blockchain scalability. It focuses on metrics like transaction costs, storage efficiency, throughput, and performance comparisons for Layer 2 networks and DA solutions. With support for EIP-4844 blobs, Avail DA, and planned integrations with other providers like EigenDA, the platform empowers developers, researchers, and the community to optimize infrastructure, monitor DA performance, and make data-driven decisions. Blobs.Guru bridges the gap between technical data and actionable insights for a scalable blockchain ecosystem.

name: Blobscan
description:
**About Blobscan**

Blobscan is the first open-source blockchain explorer designed to navigate and visualize shard blob transactions introduced in EIP-4844. It provides essential public infrastructure to help scale Ethereum, featuring:

- üîç Advanced blob search and filtering
- üß† Rich blob decoding (including Starknet and Optimism support)
- üóÉ Multiple persistent blob storage integrations
- üìä A detailed analytics dashboard
- üîå An API for querying blobs and metrics
- üê≥ Docker and Kubernetes-ready deployment options

Our mission is to make blob data accessible, transparent, and usable for the entire Ethereum ecosystem.

**Who We Are**

We‚Äôre a small team of four developers (3 fullstack engineers and one DevOps specialist) fully committed to pushing Blobscan forward as a vital part of Ethereum‚Äôs scaling roadmap.

**Recent Milestones & Updates**

We‚Äôve shipped a number of important updates and new features, including:

**üîß Core Improvements**

- Collaboration with ethPandaOps to prepare for the Dencun fork.
- Collaboration with Load Network (prev. WeaveVM) as a new blob storage solution
- Partnered with Ethereum Swarm, now sponsoring one year of blob storage
- Expanded support for a total of 72 rollups.

**üåê Website Enhancements**

- Introduced powerful search filters: by **slot, block, date range, and rollup**
- Launched **rollup-level metrics** and statistics
- Added **initial decoding support for Starknet and Optimism blobs**
- Major improvements to the **mobile experience**
- Numerous frontend performance and usability enhancements

**üõ† DevOps & Developer Experience**

- Re-architected the platform for better scalability and maintainability
- Made Blobscan **Kubernetes-ready**
- Improved Docker images ‚Äî now **10x smaller and faster**
- Published a **detailed deployment guide** using Kurtosis and Kubernetes
- Revamped and expanded documentation

**Funding & Outlook**

Blobscan is currently supported by **Optimism RetroPGF**, and we‚Äôre incredibly grateful for this backing. We love working on Blobscan and have an exciting roadmap of improvements ahead ‚Äî including deeper blob analytics, enhanced rollup-specific features, and broader ecosystem integrations.

We see Blobscan as a vital public good for Ethereum‚Äôs future and are committed to delivering the tools the ecosystem needs to thrive.

name: Blockchef | Blockchain; From Farm to Fork
description:
The modern food supply chain is a complex web of interactions involving farmers, processors, distributors, retailers, and consumers.

This complexity often leads to inefficiencies, fraud, and a lack of transparency. Traditional supply chains are vulnerable to numerous issues, such as counterfeit products, where unscrupulous entities introduce fake or substandard items into the supply chain. This undermines consumer trust and compromises safety.

BlockChef addresses the challenges in the area by utilizing blockchain technology to create an immutable, transparent, and secure ledger of every transaction and interaction in the food supply chain.

We've developed RPC access primarily to cater to the needs of developers and engineers. Leverage our platform to access historical blockchain data swiftly and build decentralized applications (dApps) with unmatched speed and reliability.

Key Benefits
- Instant node access without the overhead: read & write transactions and query enriched data without dedicated infrastructure and associated costs.

- Access multiple protocols APIs including Base + OP with a single subscription

- Battle tested high availability deployments: rely on our load balancing, monitoring, and failover mechanisms for a failure-resilient infrastructure and 99.9% uptime.

$blue is designed to create a sustainable economy for its holders. By integrating $blue into various products and services, we ensure continuous value addition to the ecosystem, promoting long-term growth.

We aim to develop a range of practical and engaging products that use $blue as both a payment option and a value accumulator. This will create a sustainable economy for $blue holders and continuously add value to the ecosystem.

$blue is the first-ever metameme, blending memes, art, and culture into a single, vibrant movement. It unifies all blue-themed meme coins into a unique digital experience, representing innovation in the web3 realm and challenging the traditional meme economy.

By leveraging $blue, we will create an ecosystem where users can easily integrate $blue into their digital activities. 

Our diverse product range will enhance the utility of $blue, strengthen its role in digital culture, and support a growing and engaged community.

Ecosystem Product Vision

1. Yield Farming (readiness 95%)

Introduce yield farming opportunities where users can stake their $blue tokens in liquidity pools to earn additional rewards.

2. PvP Games (in progress)

Develop Telegram miniapps and standalone games that enable users to engage in player-versus-player (PvP) games, using $blue tokens for in-game transactions and rewards.

3. TG Mini Apps (in progress)

Develop ‚ÄúThe Blue Meme Coin Challenge‚Äù - an engaging idle game within Telegram where players create and manage meme coin projects. 

Telegram mini apps are the perfect tool to attract a huge audience and create an effective funnel for user acquisition. 

By offering interactive and gamified experiences, our mini app will captivate users, keeping them engaged and active within the $blue ecosystem. 

4. $blue integrations with other projects (in progress)

Enable payments and transactions within partner apps using $blue tokens, making them a practical and functional part of users' daily routines.

This not only boosts the utility and demand for $blue but also reinforces its role as a versatile and valuable digital currency within the broader ecosystem.

5. NFTs (readiness 95%)

Integrating NFTs into the $blue ecosystem adds layers of value, engagement, and community interaction, making it a robust and appealing digital environment.

6. 

Blockchain and Crypto Education: Launch an educational platform offering courses, tutorials, and resources on blockchain technology, cryptocurrencies, and the $blue ecosystem, incentivizing learning with $blue tokens.

name: BMX
description:
BMX offers two types of decentralized perpetual exchanges, enabling increased capital efficiency for liquidity providers and a feature-abundant experience for traders. 

BMX‚Äôs ‚ÄúClassic‚Äù market offers a standard GMX-style experience enabling the acquisition of BMX-Liquidity-Token (BLT), our equivalent of GLP.

BMX‚Äôs ‚ÄúFreestyle‚Äù market utilizes the cutting-edge intents-based technology of SYMMIO to unleash access to 200+ tradeable assets with up to 60x leverage. 

This unique design directs revenue from both trading markets to BLT and BMX holders. In terms of TVL metrics, we currently host $2.8mm in trading liquidity, $2.7mm in staked tokens, and $3.3mm in combined pool2 liquidity! We've also processed over $295mm in volume across our Classic and Freestyle markets since launch, attracting >21.4k users!

Traders and liquidity providers can earn stackable yield on their deposited collateral/liquidity through BMX‚Äôs innovative asset: wBLT. 

wBLT auto-compounds BLT liquidity rewards, removing the need to manually claim yield for the user. Then, it can be utilized as a collateral asset, to borrow stables or other bluechip assets against it while continuing to earn yield. 

wBLT can also be utilized as a pool2 paired asset, enabling stackable yield for the user, from both perpetual markets in addition to pool2 liquidity rewards!

We've also added a third new product called "Based MediaX", which is our marketplace for trading NFTs on Base.

name: Bodhi
description:
Bodhi is a content protocol. It provides a layer for content incentivization. With less than 100 lines of code, it turns any Arweave ID into a speculative asset, just like a mini company. When more people buy its shares, the price goes up.

It launched on OP last December (2023). In less than 2 days, over 3000 people created over 10,000 different assets (Many OP users tried Arweave for the first time, and many Arweave users were introduced to Optimism as well).

However, Bodhi is a highly abstract protocol. To help people understand that you can build almost ANY protocol or apps on it (including Twitter, YouTube, TikTok, Mirror, Steam, GitHub, etc.), we ourselves built the very first app protocol on Bodhi, with only 60 lines of code, called Bodhi Space. It's basically a Reddit, and anyone can create their own space for any topic without permission and it's completely unstoppable. All contents and replies can be upvoted with ETH (because they are all Bodhi assets). Released in April 2024, Bodhi Space had over 90 different spaces in less than 2 days.

We'll build more protocols on Bodhi with developers from all over the world, covering different fields. This is just the beginning. In the next 10 years, we'll see Github on Bodhi, Steam on Bodhi, Twitter on Bodhi. Communities and foundations on Bodhi...

name: Bonadocs
description:
Bonadocs allows web3 engineering teams to collaborate and build applications in a very intuitive way. To simplify integrations, we've categorized our tooling as follows:

Docgen: Docgen allows developers to go from their codebase to beautiful and interactive documentation in seconds. Using our hardhat plugin, you can generate interactive documentation to query your contract methods.

Widget: Through our playground environment, you can generate widgets for your contract methods. These widgets can then be easily embedded in your docs or any react application for devs to query. This is instrumental for devrel teams, to help onboard external devs.

Playground: Our playground is a collaborative environment primarily for solidity and front-end devs to build applications. This can be used by internal engineering teams or teams across different organizations. Devrel teams can also take advantage of the playground to create a single source of truth for their protocol - making onboarding super easy for their developer community.

Protocol Registry: Our protocol registry is an open-source tool that allows you to find different popular protocols and their respective playgrounds.

On a high level, bonadocs are created to simplify the documentation, interaction, and integration of smart contracts - similar to Postman and web APIs.

Try it out: https://docs.bonadocs.com/
Playground demo: https://x.com/thisdavidboy/status/1854809292836339939

name: Bot or Not
description:
Bot or Not is building tools that help people improve the content they consume on Farcaster. Bot or Not originally launched as one of the first Farcaster Cast Actions and quickly rose into the top 10 on the Warpcast cast actions Discover list.

Since the launch in April, the Bot or Not cast action has been used over 250k times, has had over 10k unique users, has categorized nearly 22k FIDs, and still has an average of 200+ DAUs.

As the database of FID classifications was populated some Farcaster builders reached out wanting access to an API. Apps like https://www.interested.fyi/ and an open source FC client are using a beta version of the API to combat bot-like activity.

And in an attempt to make the data more openly accessible Bot or Not has started to attest classifications on Base using the Ethereum Attestation Service: https://base.easscan.org/schema/view/0x4fad2c558294b9b0d587d7047ccdd8ffbf3f14c0c03bc28471e1a72aef678747

The cast action‚Äôs original intent was to help Farcaster users quickly decipher if someone had bot-like casting behavior before they engaged with them. Using a combination of cast history and AI, Bot or Not classifies users and provides a summary of their casting habits so that people can decide for themselves if they want to engage or not.

Since launch, Bot or Not has expanded beyond just the cast action. The database of information on FID classifications is now used to power: 
Farcaptcha - a Captcha frame that is used to combat bot-like activity.
Simple Mod - anti-bot channel moderation that channel owners can set up entirely in frame.
Reply stats - a frame that breaks down how many of your recent replies are from bot-like accounts vs non-bot accounts

name: Botto
description:
Botto is a decentralized autonomous artist governed by BottoDAO. Thousands of DAO members vote on Botto's artworks on a weekly basis, providing training data to Botto's art engine. Once per week, the artwork with the most votes is auctioned off, with 50% of all auction proceeds being redistributed in ETH to the voters. The DAO participates in collective meaning making, questioning the notion of "good art" while being incentivized to align itself with the question "what would sell".

In order to more broadly distribute access to Botto, the DAO has ran community campaigns in the past, distributing a "Botto Access Pass". An Access Pass grants its holder with governance rights in the form of voting on the artist, and acts as an entry point into Botto's ecosystem. The DAO recently created a new ERC-1155 contract to bring the Access Pass to Base, providing a free mint to any voting participant on Farcaster via Frames. Over 9600 voting participants joined in on this meaning making process.

In the coming two months, the DAO will be bridging the BOTTO token (ERC-20) from Mainnet to Base, providing protocol owned liquidity to continue our journey on democratizing art. Accompanying this, the DAO is to offer all users the ability to claim its voting rewards in ETH. Finally, the DAO is launching a questing system native to Base, where new project entrants (starting with Base Access Pass holders!) the ability to earn the protocol‚Äôs native token, $BOTTO, simply by participating in training Botto. We see Botto as a playful, digestible point of entry for users new and old. TL;DR ‚Äì we‚Äôre very excited to continue building on Base and can‚Äôt wait to launch what we‚Äôve been working on!

name: brainbot/Shutter
description: Shutter is a threshold encryption protocol with a wide variety of applications, including: malicious MEV prevention, censorship resistance, voting integrity, and gaming fairness. Most relevant for the OPStack ecosystem is that we have built and deployed a dedicated OP Stack L2 testnet with an in-protocol threshold encrypted mempool and are looking into generalizing this solution to more advanced cryptography primitives as well as deploying it across OP Stack networks.

name: Brainbot/Shutter
description:
Shutter is a threshold encryption protocol with a wide variety of applications, including: malicious MEV prevention, censorship resistance, voting integrity, and gaming fairness.

Shielded Trading.

Shielded Trading is the main focus on Shutter Network, we aim to provide a solution for front-running prevention through transaction encryption using threshold cryptography-based distributed key generation (DKG). An encrypted mempool prevents the parts of MEV that are considered malicious (front-running, sandwich attacks) while leaving the distribution of the benign types of MEV (arbitrage, liquidations).

End users, especially from DEXs and DEFI, benefit the most from shielded mempools. It strikes the best balance between ensuring market efficiency and minimizing malicious MEV. In other words, users enjoy a higher degree of base layer neutrality leading to a) better and fairer prices on DEXs and DeFi protocols due to front-running protection and b) an additional censorship resistance layer.

An additional benefit is that the encrypted mempool adds base layer neutrality and ensures that the sequencer's role remains impartial, making it impossible for end users or regulators to accuse the sequencer or other involved parties of market manipulation. The encryption of the mempool obscures transaction details, preventing any party from manipulating or censoring transactions based on their content. Ensuring that the transaction order is free from interference and aligns with regulatory goals of maintaining fair and transparent market practices, potentially fostering a more cooperative relationship between blockchain networks and regulatory bodies. This minimizes regulatory threats; for example, the Markets in Crypto-Assets Regulation MICA could treat front running and other types of MEV as ‚Äúmarket abuse‚Äù (https://twitter.com/paddi_hansen/status/1795084797238256110)

Shutter performed a feasibility study for Front-running protection via shielded mempool for OP Stack using threshold encryption (https://gov.optimism.io/t/shutterized-optimism-an-encrypted-mempool-for-the-op-stack/) and we are currently developing a module for the OP Stack. We are also in talks with multiple L2s, RaaS (Rollops as a Service) and shared sequencer projects to integrate mempool/transaction encryption on their solutions and integrations. They have already announced a partnership with Espresso to introduce an encrypted mempool for the Espresso sequencer network.

Shielded Voting. 

Shutter protects DAO votes from manipulation by whales. Votes are encrypted when cast and revealed after the voting period ends.


Shielded Voting is integrated with Snapshot, it is currently used by 382 unique communities. It has protected over 2,330 proposals and 216,805 casted votes.

description:
Welcome to the "Realm of Valor," an immersive NFT RPG universe. Introducing our latest character, "Desya the Valiant." He emerges as a rising force within the realm, grasping his weapon with unwavering determination. With his distinctive orange hair catching the light, Desya is a symbol of courage.

In this fantastical realm, Desya embarks on a series of daring quests and adventures. With unyielding resolve, he explores enigmatic realms, battles formidable creatures, seeks out ancient artifacts, hones his skills, and forms bonds with fellow adventurers. Each NFT artwork captures a pivotal moment in Desya's saga, showcasing his bravery, resourcefulness, and journey towards becoming a legendary figure.

In this project, artists employ their remarkable skills to vividly capture Desya's essence within NFT artworks. "Realm of Valor" presents a world rich in detail, intricate design, and imaginative settings, delivering an RPG adventure in all its digital glory.

Through blockchain technology, the NFT artworks of "Realm of Valor" are preserved, ensuring their distinctiveness and authenticity, eternally encapsulating the grandeur of the RPG odyssey and Desya's legacy within the digital art realm. These creations transcend visual pleasure; they also pay homage to RPG narratives and the spirit of valor.

name: Brave Together
description: Times can be rough. One of us can have a bad day. One of us can have a good day. Both of us can have a good or bad day. The key is to be there for each other no matter what good or bad there is. We brave the storm together, when we do, we become stronger than ever. Teamwork is both logic and love. Once we got that teamwork on lock the world of opportunities is unlimited and we just gotta go get it! Brave The Storm, It will eventually end and everything will be at a calm.

name: BRIDGE: North meets South - N3XTWAVE x NEWTRO collective drop
description:
BRIDGE was a collective synchronized drop on Zora that I conceptualized and organized, with a goal of connecting two distant geo-regions: the North, represented by Europe-based N3XTWAVE Collective, and the South, represented by Newtro Arts Collective who I invited to this project, with the selection of Latin American artists. 
As it says in the Project‚Äôs Art Statement that I wrote: 
The BRIDGE theme was inspired by bridging technology - the main mechanism of Layer 2 networks, such as Zora, that connects two separate networks enabling assets to be transferable between them. Just as on the blockchain - in this project - BRIDGE event is a way of bridging the two distant hemispheres and their artist communities, who are joining forces in this massive collective art release.
The BRIDGE code-word with its multiple meanings is the cornerstone of our mission to unite distant regions and build a borderless Web3 community that thrives on diversity and innovation.
This project also aims to bridge the disparities in representation within the art scene between the Global South and the West, seeking to transcend inequalities caused by differing political, economic, and cultural contexts. With this project we want to provide equal opportunities for all artists, and create a more balanced and interconnected global art community that celebrates diversity and different origins as its greatest strength.
We see BRIDGE as a symbol of unity, transformation, progress and endurance.
The BRIDGE drop occurring at the transition from the old to the new year, symbolizes bridging the past and future while embracing a creative intersection of tradition and innovation in the art world.
With our synchronized drop, we hope to make a significant impact shaping the Web3 landscape, while celebrating its accessibility and the wide range of opportunities it offers.
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚¨•‚óÜ‚¨•‚îÄ‚îÄ 
Full info & credits of the BRIDGE Project: 
‚óÜ Concept, Art Statement & Organizing: V5MT ‚óÜ Promo - Animated Flyers + N3XTWAVE Mirror Profile: V5MT ‚óÜ Event Flyer: stipinpixel ‚óÜ VR Gallery initiative: Newtro ‚óÜ VR Gallery builders: UgoDigi & Datura - North side, + Eltito - South side + glb bridge: V5MT + later Eltito optimizing & installing it to connect both sides of the gallery ‚óÜ Release Date: January 3rd 2024 ‚óÜ Platform: zora.co ‚óÜ Network: ZORA ‚óÜ Featured Artists: N3XTWAVE: Bleu281, Francoise Gamma, V5MT, Datura, Jerome Allavena , Lucas Lejeune, Nicholas Dietrich, Ugo, k0ch, Mostwrongking, Element Lee + Newtro Represented LatAm Artists (selected collectively by N3XTWAVE members): cap'n, stipinpixel, mariana Ju, Pipi Universel, Ed Marola, m.suksu, Moranicol , Danyrus, Jotta.rs, Aura, Santiago Ruau.
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚¨•‚îÄ‚îÄ 
Notes:
‚¨•I'm submitting this project from my personal Farcaster account, not N3XTWAVE, which I set up but didn't have time to manage.‚¨•Because we decided not to use a collaborative contract for this drop, (since it was a new feature and we weren‚Äôt sure how to implement it), I'm linking to my Mirror article with all the minted pieces embedded, instead of linking to Zora.‚¨•I plan to share the potential reward from this submission and distribute it to the artists accordingly.

name: Bright Moments
description:
Bright Moments is a digital art organization that started in Venice Beach and has gone on to establish art communities around the world through the creation of unique, in-person experiences & CryptoCitizens. We work with generative and AI artists to help them produce iconic real world experiences of their art. We have established communities in LA, New York, Berlin, London, Mexico City, Tokyo, Buenos Aires, Paris, and Venice.

As part of our mission to onboard new people to crypto, we expanded our onchain footprint to enable marketplace and waitlist functionality on Base. Our events typically attract thousands of people, many of whom are interacting with crypto for the first time. Using Base for our waitlist allowed us to significantly lower the cost to request entry to the event and expanded the number of potential applications. We also used Base to host our daily auction for VIP experiences, achieving better price discovery through lower transaction costs. 

We are excited about the opportunity offered by L2s and plan to continue deepening our integration with the OP ecosystem.

Build For Good is a solo-builder initiative dedicated to educating, empowering, and inspiring the Optimism Collective through creative and accessible public goods.

I created an illustrated book about Optimism and RetroPGF, and translated a full educational version into 10 languages ‚Äî all published openly on GitHub, Mirror, and Farcaster.
Alongside the book, I launched 4 NFT collections on Optimism:
 ‚Ä¢ üÉè Educational OP Cards

 ‚Ä¢ üìö A fully illustrated comic (‚ÄúMeme Saves the Day‚Äù) in both NFT and PDF formats

I also created the BuildForGood Bot ‚Äî an AI chatbot that showcases my contribution.
In addition, I launched a YouTube channel with 3 educational and motivational videos about Optimism.
To experiment with governance, I created a trial DAO on Aragon and submitted a live proposal with onchain voting.

Everything is open, onchain, and community-oriented ‚Äî designed to expand Optimism‚Äôs reach globally.

üß° Now I‚Äôm ready to scale this impact ‚Äî with RetroPGF support.

name: Bunni
description:
Bunni is the most advanced decentralized exchange that maximizes liquidity provider profits in all market conditions.

Bunni has the following features:

- Shapeshifting liquidity: Dynamic, programmable liquidity distribution that can automatically adjust to market conditions, optimizing capital efficiency and reducing impermanent loss.
- Rehypothecation: Ability to put idle assets to work in external protocols, generating additional yield for liquidity providers without compromising swap efficiency.
- am-AMM: Auction-Managed Automated Market Maker mechanism that recaptures MEV and optimizes swap fee revenue, aligning incentives between LPs, arbitrageurs, and the protocol.
- Autonomous rebalancing: Eliminates the need for external keepers by automatically adjusting pool composition to maintain optimal ratios.

name: Callthis
description:
Callthis is a better transaction builder:
- Generate an interface for any contract, even if it's unverified. (Powered by WhatsABI)
- Build a transaction and save it as a link that can be shared and executed later.
- Works with any EVM chain, with WalletConnect or Safe Wallets or browser-injected providers.
- Address fields automatically resolved with ENS.
- Supports complex contract inputs with tuples, arrays, etc.
- No backend services required, grab the source and run it locally for privacy and censorship-resistance!
- Permissively licensed under MIT, use it in your products.

description: CantinaVerse aims to unify fragmented sectors by offering NFT, DeFi, gaming, and DAO functionalities on Optimism‚Äôs Superchain. This unified approach provides a cohesive and comprehensive ecosystem where users can seamlessly engage in diverse blockchain activities, enhancing accessibility and promoting L2 adoption. By simplifying user experiences, we address gaps in existing single-feature platforms and drive user engagement within Optimism.

name: CantinaVerse
description:
CantinaVerse is a revolutionary blockchain ecosystem built on Optimism's cutting-edge Superchain, combining an NFT marketplace, advanced ERC20 token creation tools, immersive casino games, and a governance framework (DAOs) to empower creators, gamers, and investors. Our mission is to foster a thriving digital economy where creativity, engagement, and financial empowerment converge.

As a passionate team of blockchain enthusiasts, developers, game designers, and digital artists, we are united by a shared vision to transform the way people interact with digital assets. CantinaVerse is more than just a platform‚Äîit‚Äôs a vibrant, user-driven ecosystem that prioritizes user experience, security, and community participation. By leveraging blockchain technology, we make it easy for anyone to engage in the world of NFTs, gaming, DeFi, and decentralized governance.

What We Offer:

NFT Marketplace: A dynamic platform where artists and collectors connect through seamless buying, selling, and auctioning of NFTs. Our NFT Collections feature allows creators to customize every detail, from naming conventions to royalties, while users can mint NFTs directly through our intuitive minting page.

[Coming Soon] ERC-20 Token Creation: A user-friendly platform that allows anyone to create ERC20 tokens with full customization, offering liquidity pooling options that make it easy for tokens to trade on decentralized exchanges (DEXs) once a threshold is met.

[Coming Soon] Casino Gaming Platform: A range of exciting blockchain-compatible games, built with fairness and transparency in mind. Powered by trusted oracle networks like Gelato, our games offer users the chance to stake, bet, and win in a secure environment.

[Coming Soon] Governance DAO Platform: A governance structure that puts decision-making power directly into the hands of the community. Users can vote on new game integrations, platform upgrades, and community initiatives, shaping the future of CantinaVerse collectively.

Why It Matters:

CantinaVerse democratizes access to blockchain technology, enabling a wide range of users‚Äîwhether they‚Äôre seasoned crypto enthusiasts or newcomers‚Äîto participate in the evolving digital asset landscape. Through creative expression, financial opportunities, and meaningful community engagement, CantinaVerse fosters a more inclusive, decentralized economy.

By joining CantinaVerse, the Optimism Collective can help drive this transformation forward. Together, we can build a future where blockchain technology is not only more accessible but also more rewarding for all users. Whether you‚Äôre an artist, a developer, a gamer, or an investor, there‚Äôs a place for you in CantinaVerse.

Let‚Äôs create the future of blockchain together.

name: Checkin: Location-based ‚ÄúCheckin and Earn‚Äù social to connect IRL and onchain
description:
Checkin is a location-based social app built on top of the Farcaster social graph. Users can explore, checkin and earn rewards for discovering the world around them.
  
Checkin Demo:
https://youtu.be/mGKibG2xfhA


## Problem

We believe there is a disconnect between onchain identities and our IRL identities.

Onchain data is only a small part of our identity; most of our lives are offchain or IRL data - IRL data has a lot of signal that can be added to onchain data.

Our conviction is that in the future in order to have meaningful engagement with users, we need to bridge IRL/offchain activities to our onchain identities.
  
Vision
  
Checkin is enriching digital identities by bridging IRL activities to onchain identity.  By tying IRL activities to wallets (e.g. earning a ‚ÄúRamen Lovers‚Äù badge checking into 5 ramen places), Checkin enables users to own their combined IRL and onchain identities, and builders can then create new and exciting experiences with this location/IRL-centric data. The highest signal of your interests is voting with your feet.  Being a location-centric social app that taps into onchain social graphs, we encourage people to be more social and touch grass with friends more often.

When bridging IRL activities to onchain identities, users can benefit from better personalization when interacting with onchain projects. Projects benefit from improved engagement and conversions when they have more context on who their users are beyond financial transactions.

  
 
IRL Social Experiences:
- At ETHCC this year a member of the Checkin community organized a Checkin Challenge tour where they selected a list of local places to ‚Äòcheckin‚Äô with other ETHCC attendees.  Over a dozen ETHCC attendees decided to make new friends and explore new surroundings using Checkin
- We partnered with POAP to create ‚ÄúPOAP Rally Tokyo‚Äù where users can checkin to 9 shrines across Tokyo to earn cool POAPs and a chance to win one of 3 cool darumas designed by a local Japanese artist.  Extending on this we organized 2 walking tours of Tokyo where 20+ people signed up to touch grass and our spirits.

name: Chibi Clash Kingdoms
description:
Chibi Clash is a fantasy gaming universe and the first AI-powered game built on Base. Within the Chibi Clash gaming universe, Chibi Kingdoms is the on-chain land meta game that features the largest cohesive map ever created by generative AI. Players take on the roles of warriors or warlords, navigating a dynamic world that evolves based on their actions and decisions.

Key features include:

1) Generative AI -- Land plots in Chibi Kingdoms are visually and narratively connected, forming an expansive and ever-evolving world. New and improved artwork is generated during world events and upgrades, ensuring fresh and dynamic gameplay.

2) Dynamic Play -- Chibi Clash Kingdoms connects to two other games in the universe, each providing unique experiences that blend strategy, adventure, and AI-driven gameplay. This diversity appeals to both casual players and hardcore strategists.

3) Autonomous AI -- Non-player characters roam the lands at will, offering aid or rewards, generating new lore, changing landscapes, and creating new gaming experiences.

name: Chibi Clash Kingdoms
description:
Chibi Clash is a groundbreaking fantasy gaming universe that transcends traditional gaming boundaries with interconnected gameplay and transformative actions. In Chibi Clash, every treasure you find and every quest you complete doesn't just stay within one game; they unlock new potentials and alter realities across our gaming universe.

Chibi Clash Kingdoms is our meta game that introduces an innovative layer of gameplay with land ownership at its heart. Players will navigate through a meticulously crafted world, facing challenges and engaging in strategic gameplay to accumulate Kingdom Points, enriching their journey within the Kingdoms. 

In its initial form, the Kingdoms map forms a 50x50 grid with 2496 individual land plots. Altogether, the land plots will form the largest cohesive game map ever generated by AI to date.

Chonks on Base, accessible via Chonks.xyz, is an innovative NFT project built on the Base blockchain, which launched in December 2024. 

It‚Äôs a fully on-chain, customizable profile picture (PFP) collection that leverages the ERC-6551 standard, also known as Token Bound Accounts (TBAs). This standard allows each Chonk‚Äîa digital character‚Äîto act as a unique NFT that can hold and manage its own traits, such as accessories, outfits, or other customizable features. 

Users can mint, collect, and trade these traits through the Chonks Marketplace, a platform specifically designed for this ecosystem. 

The project emphasizes creativity and flexibility, offering an online Chonks Studio where anyone can design and customize their Chonk, while approved creators can contribute new traits for seasonal releases.

name: Circuitscan.org
description:
Circuitscan.org is a circuit verifier explorer. Like verified contracts, a verified circuit verifier allows users to interact with applications directly if the frontend becomes unusable as well as ensures that the deployed source code matches the expected source code. Developers use a CLI to submit their circom sources to the verification server just like how Hardhat and Foundry submit deployed contracts to Etherscan. The frontend catalogs all verified submissions with source code and proving keys available for usage.

Circuit verifier Solidity contracts verified on Etherscan are opaque to the viewer. There's no way to quickly check that they match the source code on Github. When users can see this match, they can be sure that there's no backdoors inserted clandestinely.

Verified contracts on etherscan also come into play when a dapp's frontend becomes unusable. For a zk app with a missing frontend, Circuitscan provides a tool for generating proofs so that users never have to worry about being locked out.

description:

To address concerns about impartiality and delegate discomfort in voting on violations, the Council was formed, undergoing two rescopings to refine its role.

Note: In the S5 scope for the role, it was intended that the majority of the funding be from RetroPGF. In S6, the budget was increased per member, and therefore that different team is not applying. From S5 budget: ‚ÄúEach Council member will receive a stipend of 3,000 OP at the end of the Season. name: Concero | Sub-minute cross-chain TXs for Optimism
description:
Concero's fully decentralized infrastructure executes cross-chain transactions in less than a minute with no security compromises. Coupled with gas abstraction, routing and aggregation, Concero offers developers all the necessary tools to build secure, quick, and easy-to-use cross-chain apps.

- Member of Chainlink BUILD
- Grants from: Aave, Arbitrum, and Uniswap

Having spent over 6 months creating prototypes, iterating, surveying and interviewing our users we have identified three main attributes that an end user is looking for in cross-chain infrastructure:

1. Speed 
2. Security 
3. Ease of use

Back then, we were looking for a suitable infrastructure but were surprised to find out such infrastructure doesn‚Äôt exist. This is when we decided to pivot from building a consumer product to the infrastructure to power the next generation of cross-chain apps, using CCIP as the most secure and decentralised settlement layer. Coupled with Chainlink Functions we have accelerated transactions from 26 minutes down to less than a minute. 

Our products:

- Web app, which demonstrates the capabilities of our infrastructure and allows users to perform effortless cross-chain swaps & staking.

- Cross-chain SDK for blockchain developers to scale their DeFi apps across multiple networks in one simple integration. 

- Solidity DevKit for decentralised integrations into aggregators and DeFi apps on a smart-contract level.

The first networks to be supported by our infrastructure are Optimism, Base, and Arbitrum. We are delighted to be part of the Optimism ecosystem.

name: Concrete Geth
description:
Concrete Geth is a fork of op-geth that lets developers easily extend the execution engine to include custom precompiles and RPC APIs.

I started working on it around April 2023 after I realized a lot of the code for the custom execution engine I was working on at the time could be generalized to abstract developers away from all the heavy lifting involved in forking op-geth. 

Since then, the repo has earned 47 stars and welcomed 8 external contributors, as well as been behind some remarkable proofs-of-concept, such as a game engine built into the execution engine.

name: Consensus R&D (Ethereum Research)
description:
The Consensus R&D team focuses on both short and long-term research and development projects that aim to improve Ethereum‚Äôs security, sustainability, and scalability while retaining strong decentralization. This includes proof-of-stake consensus design, crypto-economic mechanism design, software simulations and experiments, spec writing, security assessments, testing, and more.

Here are some of the projects and research directions that we have been involved with over the period covered by this RPGF round:

- Inclusion lists: in the first half of 2024, an existing inclusion list proposal has been refined together with client teams, culminating in [EIP-7547](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7547), which was for a time considered for inclusion in Electra. Though that has not transpired, the work on EIP-7547 has still informed our understanding of the inclusion list design space. Eventually, this work has led to further research on more distributed inclusion list mechanisms, such as [FOCIL](https://ethresear.ch/t/fork-choice-enforced-inclusion-lists-focil-a-simple-committee-based-inclusion-list-proposal/19870)

- MaxEB: our team has greatly contributed to the development of the MaxEB proposal, both with [early research and security analysis](https://notes.ethereum.org/nHqON5l7SACkL_nPwz8Vqw) and with spec development. This has led to [EIP-7251](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7251), which has been included in the Electra fork. The MaxEB spec has meanwhile been incorporated in the [Electra spec](https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/tree/dev/specs/electra).

- PeerDAS: research, spec writing and coordination of the development effort. Starting from last fall, many research posts have been written on the topic, culminating in the [PeerDAS spec](https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/tree/dev/specs/_features/eip7594) as a feature in the Ethereum consensus specifications, and with the corresponding [EIP-7594](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7594) being considered for inclusion in the next fork. 

- Consensus protocol research: much research work has gone into the topic of Single Slot Finality, with papers, [ethresearch posts](https://ethresear.ch/t/orbit-ssf-solo-staking-friendly-validator-set-management-for-ssf/19928), a [wip high-level spec](https://github.com/fradamt/ssf) being worked on, among other things. 

- Staking economics: our team actively participates in research around staking economics and generally the future of staking.

name: Context Podcast: Views on Crypto and Culture
description: My name is Blake Finucane, I wrote the first ever academic thesis on crypto art as part of my art history master's degree back in 2018. I started the Context Podcast over 2 years ago with a focus on the intersection of art and crypto, leaning into the non economic upsides of the space and my academic background. My guests have included: Jerry Saltz, Pulitzer Prize winning art critic, Arianna Simpson, GP @ a16z Crypto, Botto, Lead Operator and Natalie Stone, GM of Crypto Punks. I believe my point of view is incredibly unique and the conversations I have are inspiring and important. The podcast is produced by Boys Club, who I am also an advisor for, I believe Boys Club is one of the most important culture voices in crypto today. Recently, I have also experimented with incentivized mints as a way to monetize and distribute my podcast.

name: Coppa Nouns
description: Coppa Nouns is a f√∫tbol-centered Nouns derivative. One Coppa Noun is auctioned off every 90 minutes. Coppa Nouns brings real-world games on-chain in a fun and engaging way. All of the heads are f√∫tbol-related, and all the bodies represent the kits of countries participating in national tournaments, such as the Euros, Copa America, and the World Cup. By owning a Coppa Noun from a particular country, you are eligible to win rewards for real-world games based on how well those countries perform. For example, if you own a Germany Coppa Noun and Germany wins the Euros, you would split the first-place rewards with anyone else who owns a Germany Coppa Noun!

name: Coppa Nouns
description:
The Beautiful Game Onchain

Coppa Nouns is a football-loving DAO that brings the beautiful game onchain. When you mint a Coppa Noun, the kit your Coppa Noun wears determines which country it represents. During major tournaments, owners of Coppa Nouns have the opportunity to win rewards for the country they represent.

Funds from auctions, along with sponsorships from those who believe in our mission, go towards Coppa Nouns tournaments. These rewards are then distributed back to the community of Coppa Noun holders based on how well their country plays.

If you believe in a team or want to support your favorite country, mint a Coppa Noun and help us bring the beautiful game onchain.

name: Cosmic Crooks
description: I'm Ken from Venezuela. At 34 years old, I am a father of three girls and a husband. For as long as I can remember, I have been a passionate gamer. My story on the Internet began in 2015, working behind the scenes to take advantage of every opportunity and generate income in cryptocurrency. This allowed me to face the crisis that affected my country, Venezuela. In 2017, I was lucky to meet some wonderful people who I collaborated with as a columnist and community manager on Telegram and Discord. I also participated in very lucrative airdrops. Thanks to these experiences, I managed to overcome significant difficulties. Overall Concept: However, everything changed with the arrival of the Covid-19 pandemic. A year ago, an idea occurred to me: to work on an NFT project together with my 12-year-old daughter Georgina. Georgina has an innate talent for drawing, anime and graphic design. This is how our project was born: Cosmic Crooks. The concept behind Cosmic Crooks is a mix between Pokemon's Team Rocket and the world of cryptocurrencies. It has nothing to do with Pokemon, but is inspired by the idea of going beyond, like a rocket to the moon. Together, my daughter and I work hard every day, respecting her school schedule and responsibilities. We spend every free moment for 1 whole year generating concepts for our NFT project. Now, we're ready with the Collection of 3,000 PFPs. The images is created by hand on a Tablet and polished in Photoshop. Each PFP has their own unique and different personality from each other.

Our modular architecture includes vault primitives such as Multisig, Rune-based Syndicates, Airdrop Vaults, and Non-Custodial Staking, and structured vaults that can manage bundling RWA, compliant issuance of vault positions and payouts to vault members.

Our vision extends beyond the immediate needs of crypto natives. Covault Protocol aims to support builders and power efficient markets for financial instruments, intellectual property (IP), and future earning contracts.¬†

name: Credit
description:
Credit is a lending protocol that requires no credit scoring, income verification, collateral, or external enforcement mechanisms. Instead, it operates purely through mathematical incentive design and powered by World's proof of personhood.

Our prototype, launched through the World app in Argentina, has already demonstrated remarkable traction since December: 175,000+ unique users, 27,000+ loans issued for 15,000+ borrowers (verified as humans), and 145,000+ individuals on our waitlist. These aren't crypto enthusiasts‚Äîthey're everyday people using these loans for groceries, transportation, and medicine, largely unaware of the breakthrough technology enabling their financial access.

name: Credit
description: Credit allows borrowing dollars instantly - no collateral needed. Users can build their credit history with every repayment and unlock better rates and higher limits. No paperwork. No waiting. Just simple, fast lending.

name: CREDITONCHAIN
description:
Built on Mint Blockchain, CreditONCHAIN is redefining the way individuals interact with their data. We empower users to own, control, verify, and monetize their digital footprints, ensuring that the value generated‚Äîboth economic and reputational‚Äîflows back to the individual. In a world where data is often exploited by centralized entities, we are creating a decentralized ecosystem that prioritizes digital sovereignty.

Our journey begins in the creator economy, where we are helping users establish their reputations as NFT collectors and creators. As AI-generated content becomes more prevalent, the human role evolves into one of curation, connection, and meaning-making. CreditONCHAIN provides the tools to prove personhood, build trust, and unlock value in this new era.

At its core, CreditONCHAIN is about transforming passive data generation into active value creation. Every onchain interaction‚Äîevery trade, every creation, every connection‚Äîcontributes to a dynamic, verifiable reputation that belongs solely to the individual. This reputation becomes a bridge between data owners and data consumers, enabling a fair, transparent, and user-centric value distribution model.

Through innovations like the COC Power Badge, users can secure lifetime membership benefits and passive income from their data. As onchain experiences expand into governance, entertainment, consumption, and social activities, blockchain-based reputations will become essential components of personal digital identity.

We envision a future where individuals are no longer bystanders in the data economy but active participants, recognized and rewarded for their digital actions. CreditONCHAIN is here to ensure that the value and control of data are returned to the individuals who generate it, empowering them to thrive as sovereign entities in the decentralized world.

name: Crowdmuse
description:
Crowdmuse is a social commerce platform facilitating transparent payment distribution and collaborative drops for creators and brands. Our custom contract is compatible on the Superchain with Optimism, Base, and Zora Network, boasting over 10,000 transactions across these networks. With a transaction volume exceeding $50,000 on paid mints, our platform empowers creators to sell and showcase digi-physical product drops seamlessly. By leveraging the CrowdmuseProduct Contract and Crowdmuse Merch Frame on Farcaster, creators retain full sovereignty over assets and funds, providing a user-centric approach to web3 adoption. 

Through our partnerships across the Superchain, including Optimism and Base, we aim to drive consumer adoption and showcase the potential of Optimism as a consumer brand, targeting communities beyond the web3 space.

We are onboarding creators, brands and manufacturers onchain with our smart contract and ecommerce infra for a seamless payment and checkout experience. Creators and brands can utilize the CrowdmuseProduct Contract to sell products directly from their wallets or create a wallet using our Privy wallet abstraction plugin. This setup ensures complete control over assets and enables permissionless fund distribution.  

By building out a consumer crypto use case that regular people can enjoy, we are incentivizing long-term user adoption, especially as creators see new revenue opportunities through sustainable business models onchain. 

With our track record of product drops on Base, Optimism and Zora Network, we aim to demonstrate the potential of the Superchain to scale. Our goal is to drive end-user adoption of Optimism by introducing innovative consumer experiences tailored to communities beyond web3.

We‚Äôre building an ecosystem which is transparent by design, giving consumers the information to shape commerce. This is especially important in consumer goods like fashion, where a lack of traceability has enabled extractive business models to thrive without accountability.

name: Crypto
description: About Crypto

name: crypto 2025
description:
Cryptocurrency is a form of digital or virtual currency that uses cryptography for security. Unlike traditional currencies issued by governments (fiat currency), cryptocurrencies are decentralized and typically operate on blockchain technology, a distributed ledger maintained by a network of computers (nodes).

Here are some key aspects of cryptocurrency:

### 1. **Blockchain Technology**
   - The foundation of most cryptocurrencies is blockchain. It‚Äôs a decentralized, digital ledger that records all transactions across a network. Each "block" contains a list of transactions, and "chains" of blocks are linked together in a chronological order.
   - Blockchain ensures transparency, security, and immutability, meaning once information is added, it cannot be altered.

### 2. **Decentralization**
   - Cryptocurrencies aren't controlled by a central authority like a bank or government. Instead, they rely on networks of computers (also called nodes) to validate transactions and manage the network. This decentralization is one of the key selling points of cryptocurrencies, as it makes them resistant to government interference and manipulation.

### 3. **Cryptography**
   - Cryptocurrencies use cryptographic techniques to secure transactions and control the creation of new units. This ensures that only authorized parties can perform transactions. Common cryptographic methods include public and private keys for digital wallets and hashing algorithms to secure the blockchain.

### 4. **Popular Cryptocurrencies**
   - **Bitcoin (BTC)**: The first and most well-known cryptocurrency. It was created by an anonymous person (or group) under the pseudonym Satoshi Nakamoto in 2009. Bitcoin operates on a proof-of-work consensus mechanism.
   - **Ethereum (ETH)**: A platform that allows developers to build decentralized applications (dApps) using smart contracts, which are self-executing contracts with terms directly written into code. Ethereum is transitioning from a proof-of-work to a proof-of-stake system (Ethereum 2.0) to improve scalability and reduce energy consumption.
   - **Other Cryptocurrencies**: Litecoin (LTC), Ripple (XRP), Cardano (ADA), and Solana (SOL) are examples of other popular cryptocurrencies, each with their own unique features and use cases.

### 5. **Mining and Staking**
   - **Mining**: The process of validating new transactions and adding them to the blockchain by solving complex mathematical problems. Miners are rewarded with cryptocurrency (such as Bitcoin) for their efforts. Bitcoin uses the proof-of-work (PoW) system for mining.
   - **Staking**: In contrast, proof-of-stake (PoS) cryptocurrencies require participants to hold and lock up a certain amount of cryptocurrency to validate transactions. Staking is seen as a more energy-efficient method of securing the network.

### 6. **Use Cases and Applications**
   - **Payments**: Cryptocurrencies can be used to transfer money across borders, often with lower fees and faster processing times than traditional methods.
   - **Investment**: Many people buy cryptocurrencies as an investment, hoping their value will increase over time.
   - **Decentralized Finance (DeFi)**: DeFi is a movement that leverages cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology to recreate traditional financial services like lending, borrowing, and trading in a decentralized manner.
   - **Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs)**: NFTs are unique digital assets representing ownership of items like art, music, and collectibles. They use blockchain to verify ownership.

### 7. **Volatility and Risks**
   - Cryptocurrencies are known for their price volatility. Prices can swing dramatically in short periods, which presents opportunities but also risks.
   - **Security Risks**: Cryptocurrency exchanges and wallets are sometimes targeted by hackers. Users must take extra precautions to safeguard their holdings (e.g., using hardware wallets).
   - **Regulation**: The regulatory environment for cryptocurrencies is still evolving, with governments around the world debating how to treat them. This creates uncertainty for investors and businesses in the space.

### 8. **Regulation and Legal Status**
   - Cryptocurrencies are treated differently depending on the country. Some countries like El Salvador have adopted Bitcoin as legal tender, while others like China have imposed heavy restrictions or outright bans. In many countries, cryptocurrencies are treated as assets and subject to capital gains taxes.
   - **Governments and regulators** are working to establish frameworks for cryptocurrency exchanges, anti-money laundering (AML) policies, and consumer protection.

---

If you are interested in a particular cryptocurrency, want to know about a specific topic like how to buy or trade crypto, or want to understand how it works further, feel free to ask!

name: crypto 2025
description:
Cryptocurrency is a form of digital or virtual currency that uses cryptography for security. Unlike traditional currencies issued by governments (fiat currency), cryptocurrencies are decentralized and typically operate on blockchain technology, a distributed ledger maintained by a network of computers (nodes).

Here are some key aspects of cryptocurrency:

### 1. **Blockchain Technology**
   - The foundation of most cryptocurrencies is blockchain. It‚Äôs a decentralized, digital ledger that records all transactions across a network. Each "block" contains a list of transactions, and "chains" of blocks are linked together in a chronological order.
   - Blockchain ensures transparency, security, and immutability, meaning once information is added, it cannot be altered.

### 2. **Decentralization**
   - Cryptocurrencies aren't controlled by a central authority like a bank or government. Instead, they rely on networks of computers (also called nodes) to validate transactions and manage the network. This decentralization is one of the key selling points of cryptocurrencies, as it makes them resistant to government interference and manipulation.

### 3. **Cryptography**
   - Cryptocurrencies use cryptographic techniques to secure transactions and control the creation of new units. This ensures that only authorized parties can perform transactions. Common cryptographic methods include public and private keys for digital wallets and hashing algorithms to secure the blockchain.

### 4. **Popular Cryptocurrencies**
   - **Bitcoin (BTC)**: The first and most well-known cryptocurrency. It was created by an anonymous person (or group) under the pseudonym Satoshi Nakamoto in 2009. Bitcoin operates on a proof-of-work consensus mechanism.
   - **Ethereum (ETH)**: A platform that allows developers to build decentralized applications (dApps) using smart contracts, which are self-executing contracts with terms directly written into code. Ethereum is transitioning from a proof-of-work to a proof-of-stake system (Ethereum 2.0) to improve scalability and reduce energy consumption.
   - **Other Cryptocurrencies**: Litecoin (LTC), Ripple (XRP), Cardano (ADA), and Solana (SOL) are examples of other popular cryptocurrencies, each with their own unique features and use cases.

### 5. **Mining and Staking**
   - **Mining**: The process of validating new transactions and adding them to the blockchain by solving complex mathematical problems. Miners are rewarded with cryptocurrency (such as Bitcoin) for their efforts. Bitcoin uses the proof-of-work (PoW) system for mining.
   - **Staking**: In contrast, proof-of-stake (PoS) cryptocurrencies require participants to hold and lock up a certain amount of cryptocurrency to validate transactions. Staking is seen as a more energy-efficient method of securing the network.

### 6. **Use Cases and Applications**
   - **Payments**: Cryptocurrencies can be used to transfer money across borders, often with lower fees and faster processing times than traditional methods.
   - **Investment**: Many people buy cryptocurrencies as an investment, hoping their value will increase over time.
   - **Decentralized Finance (DeFi)**: DeFi is a movement that leverages cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology to recreate traditional financial services like lending, borrowing, and trading in a decentralized manner.
   - **Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs)**: NFTs are unique digital assets representing ownership of items like art, music, and collectibles. They use blockchain to verify ownership.

### 7. **Volatility and Risks**
   - Cryptocurrencies are known for their price volatility. Prices can swing dramatically in short periods, which presents opportunities but also risks.
   - **Security Risks**: Cryptocurrency exchanges and wallets are sometimes targeted by hackers. Users must take extra precautions to safeguard their holdings (e.g., using hardware wallets).
   - **Regulation**: The regulatory environment for cryptocurrencies is still evolving, with governments around the world debating how to treat them. This creates uncertainty for investors and businesses in the space.

### 8. **Regulation and Legal Status**
   - Cryptocurrencies are treated differently depending on the country. Some countries like El Salvador have adopted Bitcoin as legal tender, while others like China have imposed heavy restrictions or outright bans. In many countries, cryptocurrencies are treated as assets and subject to capital gains taxes.
   - **Governments and regulators** are working to establish frameworks for cryptocurrency exchanges, anti-money laundering (AML) policies, and consumer protection.

name: Crypto: The Game S2
description:
Crypto: The Game (CTG) is an interactive, onchain survival game. Contestants buy in with 0.1 ETH, join tribes, participate in daily challenges, and vote each other out over ten-day seasons until one person wins the entire pot. CTG has been compared to Survivor, Hunger Games, and Squid Game. Players have described it as "dramatic and insanity-inducing," and "the most fun crypto experience in years."

CTG, launched as a unique crypto gaming experience, had players strategizing around the clock. They communicated in tribe-specific chats and faced the potential of being voted out by their tribemates each night. They could gain immunity by topping the daily leaderboard in tribal immunity challenges, which ranged from classic arcade games to digital scavenger hunts and crypto puzzles.

CTG S2, built on Base, was designed with only 800 spots available. These spots sold out in 13 minutes, with each 0.1 ETH NFT contributing to a prize pool of nearly $300,000, which one player won. S2 also featured a new minting mechanic built on Base.

Players minted an NFT to secure their spot in The Game. This buy-in contributed toward the grand prize pot. As players were voted out, their NFTs automatically transitioned from "player" to "jury" status, as the final winner is decided by previously eliminated players. This also meant players could sell their NFT at any time, which allowed spectators and former players to buy into the game as it progressed. This mechanic, unique to crypto, created an in-game economy reminiscent of "Deal or No Deal," only possible onchain.

CTG S2 was supported by major sponsors including adidas, Uniswap, Lens, Wormhole, POAP, and Safe, and received media coverage from CoinDesk, Axios, Bankless, Decrypt, and Unchained. Boys Club hosted a daily companion podcast throughout the season. Over 10 days, the season attracted over 100,000 site visits (with more than 50,000 unique visitors), accumulating 4,000+ total hours of gameplay. Players participated from the US, Canada, UK, India, Germany, Hong Kong, Japan, Singapore, France, and the Netherlands. Crypto: The Game S2 was also the first onchain project to be listed on the ballot for a Primteime Emmy Award in the category of Outstanding Emerging Media Program.  

The contract was deployed at 0x4DfC7EA5aC59B63223930C134796fecC4258d093 from a special purpose factory at 0x3AbB25038DA5A6eE9F524CC16C7F7EC68Db7EB3b on the base superchain network.

name: CryptoZombies
description:
CryptoZombies is an interactive school that teaches students to write smart contracts by making their own crypto-collectibles game. CryptoZombies was the first tutorial on the internet for NFTs and is still very relevant to the new crop of web3 developers looking to enter the industry today. The curriculum is focused on Solidity development, which also helps onboard new developers to Optimism.

Our platform is free and used by more than 500,000 developers worldwide. Consequently, we've broadened the Optimism Collective's audience while streamlining developer onboarding. In doing so, we've blended simplicity and humor, making the art of writing smart contracts on Optimism fun and accessible. Furthermore, our Telegram community ensures prompt support from our engineers, aiding both newcomers and experienced developers alike.

We've teamed up with the Optimism Foundation to build a course, Optimism Unleashed, that teaches students to write, test, and deploy smart contracts on the OP Mainnet and use the Superchain Faucet. The course is available at https://cryptozombies.io/en/optimism.

We're also building [CryptoZombies Apocalypse](https://apocalypse.cryptozombies.io/), an Optimism-based tower defense game where players fight zombie waves to save humanity. The game includes an educational curriculum providing hands-on experience building blockchain-powered game content.

Early adopters can now claim Early Bird Badge NFTs for game access. To boost adoption, we're covering minting fees on Optimism.

name: Curia OP Governance Analytics Dashboard
description:
We are the team behind the Curia OP Governance Analytics Dashboard, a comprehensive tool designed to empower the Optimism Collective through transparency and data-driven insights. Our dashboard provides essential governance metrics such as participation rates, voting power distribution, delegates' performance, and voting history. By continuously refining our features based on community feedback, we've enriched stakeholder engagement and informed decision-making processes.

Since last year, we've introduced significant enhancements to the dashboard, including:

Citizen House Integration: We now provide comprehensive data visualization tools for the Citizen House, focusing on Badgeholder analytics and veto proposals. This update enables a clearer understanding of activities within the Citizen House and enhances transparency around proposal results and participation.

RetroPGF Project Analytics: Our dashboard now offers detailed tracking and insights into RetroPGF projects, including an Application Funnel Overview that displays the entire project application process, from submission to decision. We also provide analytics on ongoing and upcoming RetroPGF projects, including RetroPGF 3 & 4, ensuring that the community can better understand and monitor project dynamics and impact.

UI and User Experience Improvements: We revamped the user interface, enhancing the visibility of delegate voting power and improving the navigation bar for easier interaction. Our new delegate card feature allows for more detailed and interactive insights, making it easier for users to track individual delegate activity.

Partial Delegation Integration: We introduced detailed insights into the sources of a delegate's voting power, distinguishing between partial and full delegations. This feature provides a more granular view of each delegate‚Äôs influence within the governance process.

Delegate Ranking Bump Chart: A dynamic tool that visualizes the evolution of delegates‚Äô voting power over various timeframes, offering a detailed view of ranking changes to better understand the governance dynamics.

Through these updates, the Curia OP Governance Analytics Dashboard has continued to foster a culture of accountability, transparency, and informed governance across the Optimism Collective, empowering stakeholders to make astute, data-driven decisions.

name: Custom Gas Token
description:
OP Labs is a software development and consulting company, specializing in cloud-based computation and blockchain development.
For this project, OP Labs created a function to enable custom gas token support as part of the standard OP Chain configuration.
Custom gas token is a beta feature and has been merged into the main smart contract codebase. All future releases of smart contract code will include the custom gas token feature. All chains will ultimately be upgraded to using the smart contracts that include the feature and it will be able to be toggled on or off. 
The feature allows chain partners to choose their own L1 gas token if the prefer something other than Ethereum.
Optimism Superchain Partners can now deploy mainnet L2 chains both self-hosted or via RaaS providers with a custom L1 gas token. This will encourage additional adoption and increase Superchain partners by allowing flexibility towards teams‚Äô preferred L1 gas token. Custom gas token was one of our most requested features with eleven current and potential partner chains interested.
The upcoming Mainnet launches for chains publicly committed to using the Custom Gas Token feature have a combined token market cap of $1.278b

name: D√¶mons
description:
Own your on-chain history as a living, evolving AI pet.

D√¶mons is an AI-powered, Tamagotchi-meets-Pok√©mon blockchain experience where your web3 wallet becomes the foundation for a personalized, interactive companion. By analyzing your on-chain activity‚Äîwhat chains you use, protocols you interact with, and NFTs you hold‚ÄîD√¶mons generates a custom pet that evolves, battles, and grows with you.

From the moment players connect their wallet (or create one via account abstraction), they‚Äôre immersed in a journey that reflects their unique onchain footprint. New users can choose from a curated set of starter D√¶mons and accessories to begin their adventure.

D√¶mons uses the LayerZero ONFT standard to offer seamless omnichain play. Players can battle across LayerZero-supported chains or engage from non-integrated chains without friction‚Äîhelping unify the fragmented GameFi ecosystem. We are live and deployed across multiple chains including many Superchain participants right now!

Inside the app, players participate in:
‚Ä¢ PvP tournaments ‚Äì Clan-based and 1v1 battles for rewards and prestige
‚Ä¢ PvE adventures ‚Äì AI-powered experiences tailored to each D√¶mon‚Äôs identity
‚Ä¢ Points & revenue share ‚Äì Earned through gameplay, referrals, and activity

Each D√¶mon is also an AI Agent‚Äîcapable of conversation and powered by context from our docs, lore, and partner protocols. These companions don‚Äôt just fight and evolve‚Äîthey help players learn, connect, and explore the broader ecosystem in a truly interactive way.

D√¶mons brings together identity, AI, and omnichain interactivity‚Äîblending nostalgia with the future of web3 engagement.

As part of the accountability process, I committed to minting whatever was on my canvas at the end of these 30 minutes onchain using ZORA. Referred to as the "DPP," this practice was to be completed every weekday, with a limit of 13 available for free. Throughout this year, I've leveraged the mainnet, ZORA, and base chains, gaining firsthand insight into the benefits of L2s for an artist's financial well-being.

I have compiled the initial 69 Daily Process Practices into a physical book titled "Daily Process Practice" by 1HESAGER, which is now available on Metalabel. The book is equipped with an IYK NFC chip for an On-Cyber gallery tour hosted by the artist. Each piece is accompanied by personal background narratives, and the collection aims to foster community engagement and preserve creative practices for future generations.

- To make the compliance easier, we also built two additional EIP-4824 adoption pathways, through ENS txt records and EAS attestations. 
- development of DAO Attestation Registry, a website for listing DAO-related schemas deployed on EAS
