name: First NFT USDT on Base
description:
First USDT Commemorative NFT on Base Blockchain

Collection Concept:
Collection Name: "USDT on Bases Meme Squad"

Description:
A series of 1000 unique NFTs depicting meme characters themed around the USDT cryptocurrency and the Bases blockchain. Each character will have variations in colors, accessories, and expressions, creating visual diversity and collectible value.

Rarity Distribution:
Super Exclusive (10 NFTs):
Characteristics: 90% unique.
Example: A meme with an extremely rare design, such as a giant USDT with angel wings.
Exclusive (100 NFTs):
Characteristics: 70% unique.
Example: Memes with special backgrounds or accessories not available in other categories, like a USDT crown.
Rare (50 NFTs):
Characteristics: 50% unique.
Example: Memes with sunglasses made of USDT or with a Bases blockchain background.
Uncommon (500 NFTs):
Characteristics: 30% unique.
Example: Memes with minor variations like different clothing colors or facial expressions.
Common (340 NFTs):
Characteristics: 10% unique, but with some rare details.
Example: Basic memes, possibly with a small USDT or Bases logo in an unexpected place.

General Characteristics:
Meme Base: A humanoid character with traits of popular memes but adapted to the USDT and Bases theme.
Colors: A color palette based on the USDT logo (white, black, green) and Bases design, with more vibrant variations for the rare and exclusive ones.
Accessories: Glasses, hats, digital elements representing blockchain technology, and variations of USDT coins.

Art Generation:
Use digital art creation software or platforms (like Adobe Illustrator, Blender for 3D, or specific NFT tools like CryptoArt or Generative Art).
Each NFT should have a base design with multiple layers to easily vary characteristics like skin color, clothing, accessories, and backgrounds.

Implementation and Distribution on Bases Blockchain:
Smart Contracts: Develop a specific smart contract for this collection that manages the creation and distribution of the NFTs, ensuring each NFT is unique and the rarity distribution is met.
Launch Mechanism: You could opt for an auction system, direct sales, or a minting event where users can randomly obtain one of the NFTs.

Promotion:
Create a social media campaign, collaborate with influencers in the crypto world, and organize virtual events to build anticipation and increase the value of the collection.

Note:
I can't generate images, but make sure each design is original and does not infringe on any existing meme copyrights. Authenticity and creativity will be key to the success of your NFT collection.

name: FlatworldAI
description:
Flatworld AI is a blockchain-based AI game inspired by Edwin A. Abbott's classic novel "Flatland." In this unique world, you will explore a two-dimensional society composed of geometric shapes and experience a new style of gameplay.

In the Flatworld, residents are various geometric shapes living on a two-dimensional plane. The social structure is determined by the shape and number of sides of the characters, from simple triangles to complex polygons, to perfect circles, each shape representing different social classes and abilities.

As a real player, you do not directly control these residents, but instead observe and guide AI-controlled autonomous characters (NPCs) from a "god's-eye view," witnessing their lives, interactions, and growth in this flat world.

name: Flexy
description:
Flexy offers DeFi users a cost-free way to obtain tokens and gas on various networks. At its core, Flexy works as a cross-chain bridge that can deliver specific ERC20s and gas in a single, gasless transaction. Flexy is a public good that offers completely free bridging for stablecoins across OP stack L2s. Flexy currently charges a minimal 0.1% fee for non-stablecoin transfers to offset operational costs (liquidity provisioning), though we aim to offer fully-free transfers for all tokens, subsidized by retrofunding.

Utilizing EIP-2612, users need only sign a single off-chain signature to initiate a bridge transaction, reducing user friction and abstracting away crypto complexities. All values are denominated in USD to make value transfer clear and easy to understand.

Flexy can be integrated into any dApp via the Flexy widget, installable via npm. The Flexy widget allows projects across DeFi to add a tailored cross-chain bridge directly into their own dApp to deliver ERC20s and gas that users need to interact with the contracts on their supported chains.

name: Formal Verification of Optimism's L1 pausability mechanism
description:
Runtime Verification has contributed to the security of OP Stack through formal verification proofs of the L1 pausability mechanism. Our open-source formal verification tool, Kontrol, has been successfully integrated into the Optimism CI to continuously ensure that the pausability mechanism remains intact as the code evolves. 

The proofs with their respective documentation can be found at https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/tree/develop/packages/contracts-bedrock/test/kontrol. 

Kontrol is an open source, free-to-use tool, which means that the existing and future proofs can be maintained by the Optimism team. At the same time, Kontrol is actively maintained and improved by our team at Runtime Verification, thus ensuring constant performance and user experience enhancements, which are regularly upstreamed to the Optimism monorepo.

name: Foundation Mission Request: EIP-7702 UX & Developer Tooling
description:
Candide will develop tooling that enables EOA Wallets to add support for EIP-7702 by leveraging ERC-4337, and to introduce a fully audited 7702 Smart Account with features such as transaction batching and gas sponsoring. Candide will also to bring EIP-5792 batch transactions to two of popular apps on the SuperChain.


Milestone 1: EIP-7702 Account Abstraction (Delivered: on Pectra)
Supported EIP-7702 in Voltaire Bundler on the SuperChains Mainnets
Added the new json element named eip7702Auth, to hold the eip-7702 auth tuple items
Stabilized support for for EIP-7702 and EntryPoint v0.8 on Bundler
Deployed the EIP-7702 Bundler on two SuperChain Mainnets: OP Mainnet and Base
Code: https://github.com/candidelabs/voltaire
Docs: https://docs.candide.dev/wallet/bundler/rpc-methods/
Bundler Support Announcement: https://docs.candide.dev/blog/eip-7702-support/#bundler-support-for-eip-7702
Implement support for EIP-7702 in the AbstractionKit
Add support for 7702 transaction type 4 delegation authorisation
Add support for the eip7702Auth tuple in the Bundler class in the AbstractionKit
Code: https://github.com/candidelabs/abstractionkit/blob/main/src/Bundler.ts
Docs: https://docs.candide.dev/wallet/abstractionkit/bundler/
Milestone 2: EIP-7702 Smart Accounts (Delivered: on Pectra)
Integrate the fully audited Simple7702Account developed by the AA EF team into an easy-to-use class in AbstractionKit.
Write reference documentation for Simple7702Account.
Develop a guide walkthrough and a reference code repository on how to leverage EIP-7702 features, such as batch transactions and gas sponsorship.
Code: https://github.com/candidelabs/abstractionkit
Simple7702Account Reference Docs: https://docs.candide.dev/wallet/abstractionkit/simple-7702-account/
Guide: https://docs.candide.dev/wallet/guides/getting-started-eip-7702/
Milestone 3: World-Class Open-Source App Integration (Delivered: May 8, 2025)
Coordinated with the PoolTogether to open pull requests for EIP-5792 support in their respective frontends. Implement the integration using Viem actions, including:
getCapabilities to check which capabilities the wallet supports for batching, sponsorship, etc.
sendCalls to send the transactions
useCallStatus to track transaction status
Provide a fallback to sendTransaction if the wallet's capabilities do not support the EIP-5792 features.
PoolTogether Code : https://github.com/GenerationSoftware/pooltogether-client-monorepo/pull/106
PoolTogether Announcement: https://x.com/PoolTogether_/status/1920496406067880075

name: Fracton Research - Retrospective Quantitative Review of Grants
description:
This research aims to improve governance by achieving more effective public goods funding through the comparison of various grant models. Grant programs play a crucial role in the crypto ecosystem, but comparative studies are rare. In this study, we compare different types of programs such as Uniswap, dYdX, Optimism, and Gitcoin, categorizing them into "top-down," "bottom-up," and "QF (algorithmic)" types. Our findings suggest that bottom-up and QF types tend to distribute funds more evenly, with smaller grant amounts and less variability, while top-down types exhibit greater variability and tend to provide larger grants to fewer recipients.

The goal of this research is to achieve a more effective and fair grants program. We aim to uncover the differences among various grant programs and provide insights that could improve future program management. By conducting a cross-comparative quantitative analysis, focusing especially on decision-making bodies, we investigated how grant amounts and the number of grants are influenced by different types of decision-making mechanisms. Looking ahead, we plan to develop tools for impact evaluation, impact measurement, or outcome measurement based on these results. This will enable evidence-based public goods funding by using grants data, ensuring that future grants are more effective and aligned with measurable outcomes.

This research and development includes Optimism Collective as a subject of investigation, focusing on identifying the unique characteristics of the Optimism Collective, analyzing the current state of its fund distribution, and comparing it with other grant programs. This approach will contribute to designing more effective, evidence-based funding strategies and to realizing the vision of Retro Funding.

name: Fracton Research - Retrospective Quantitative Review of Grants
description:
Fracton Research is an R&D institution for a positive sum world through exploring inclusive coordination design. Our focus is to solve coordination problems and public goods problems such as the free-rider problem and tragedy of the commons, and to create positive externalities through coordination mechanisms based on blockchain: regenerative funding mechanisms, collective decision making, and other protocol design. Also, we will collaborate with profit/non-profit organizations, academic institutions, and government, so we will achieve them by getting experience and knowledge from practical fieldworks.

This research aims to improve governance by achieving more effective public goods funding through the comparison of various grant models. Grant programs play a crucial role in the crypto ecosystem, but comparative studies are rare. In this study, we compare different types of programs such as Uniswap, dYdX, Optimism, and Gitcoin, categorizing them into "top-down," "bottom-up," and "QF (algorithmic)" types. Our findings suggest that bottom-up and QF types tend to distribute funds more evenly, with smaller grant amounts and less variability, while top-down types exhibit greater variability and tend to provide larger grants to fewer recipients.

The goal of this research is to achieve a more effective and fair grants program. We aim to uncover the differences among various grant programs and provide insights that could improve future program management. By conducting a cross-comparative quantitative analysis, focusing especially on decision-making bodies, we investigated how grant amounts and the number of grants are influenced by different types of decision-making mechanisms. Looking ahead, we plan to develop tools for impact evaluation, impact measurement, or outcome measurement based on these results. This will enable evidence-based public goods funding by using grants data, ensuring that future grants are more effective and aligned with measurable outcomes.

This research and development includes Optimism Collective as a subject of investigation, focusing on identifying the unique characteristics of the Optimism Collective, analyzing the current state of its fund distribution, and comparing it with other grant programs. This approach will contribute to designing more effective, evidence-based funding strategies and to realizing the vision of Retro Funding.

name: fxhash
description:
fxhash is an open generative art platform and marketplace for creating and collecting art made with code. In housing the world's largest collection of generative art projects, fxhash offers unparalleled technology and tooling for artistic onchain communities everywhere.

After releasing our beta on Tezos in 2021, we became the world's first crosschain generative art platform with our Ethereum integration 2 years later. Now, we're excited to continue our journey, trying to tackle some of the inherent economic issues we have seen within the NFT landscape. 

Over the past few years, the NFT art market has seen meteoric rises and troubling declines, leaving many to question the sustainability of current models. Collectors are disengaging, liquidity is increasingly concentrated in the hands of a few, and the broader ecosystem of artists struggles to thrive.

As a platform dedicated to empowering generative artists, fxhash has not only witnessed this decline but also felt a responsibility to address it. We recognize that artists are much more than the sum of their individual projects; they are innovators, storytellers, and creators of culture whose impact transcends individual releases.

At fxhash we not only want to provide the tools to enable these creative visions, but also provide artists with a stable eco-system in which they can take creative risks.

Introducing the $FXH protocol: an artist-first protocol designed to empower creators by tokenizing their brands, and provide collectors with a new way to engage with the eco-system. The implementation of this vision will take shape through the $FXH ‚Üî $ARTIST token launchpad, through which artists can seamlessly create and launch their own tokens, all coupled with artistic projects.

We hope that this lays the foundations for a new community-owned, onchain art economy. More info can be found here: https://docs.fxhash.xyz/fxh-token

name: Gelato Relay SDK
description: Gelato Relay SDK offers a convenient suite of functions in order to interact with the Gelato Relay API. Gelato Relay API is a service that allows users and developers to get transactions validated fast, reliably and securely, without having to deal with the low-level complexities of blockchains. As requests are submitted to Gelato Relay, a network of decentralised Gelato Executors will execute and get the transactions validated as soon as possible. EIP-712 signatures enforce the integrity of data, while gas fee payments can be handled in any of our supported payment methods. In this way, developers can rely on Gelato's battle-tested blockchain infrastructure improving the UX, costs, security and liveness of their Web3 systems.‚Äã

name: Gitcoin
description: Since 2017, Gitcoin has been building tools that enable communities to build, fund and protect what matters to them.  We envision a world shaped by community-led positive change.

name: Gitcoin Citizens Round #1
description:
The inaugural Gitcoin Citizens Round, powered by Gitcoin Grants Stack and running on the Optimism network, ran from June 13 ‚Äì June 27, 2023, employing retroactive QF to reward contributions with proven value to the Gitcoin ecosystem. The round had a matching pool of 20K DAI and has been the most successful round to date in terms of crowdfunding versus matching, having the highest-ever matching pool multiplier with quadruple the available matching funds made in donations. (80K)

Conceptually, running these rounds lowers the barrier of entry for contributing to Gitcoin, determines what the community values most, and helps test (dogfood) the Allo protocol.

Specifically, the three objectives of this experiment were:

1) To gain experience using quadratic funding and the Allo protocol to build our own ecosystem, demonstrate effectiveness, and identify areas for improvement.
2) To experiment with a supplementary budgeting process that has greater accountability and less administrative overhead.
3) To increase community engagement and participation at all levels of Gitcoin from contribution to governance

name: Giveth
description:
Giveth is an open-source, radically transparent, user-friendly donation platform that supports verified public goods projects to raise crypto with zero added fees and no intermediaries. We build and advance novel fundraising mechanisms like quadratic funding, donor rewards, and decentralized project curation.

Today, Giveth supports donations on eleven chains and networks, including Optimism, Ethereum Mainnet, Celo, and Base.  

Giveth has been live on Optimism since 2023, enabling projects to accept Optimism donations (over $570,000 USD raised on OP Mainnet as of March 2025). Through our GIVbacks program, we have rewarded donors to verified projects with over 18.1 million OP Mainnet GIV to date. As of March 2025, over 101 million $GIV is staked in our contracts on OP Mainet, increasing Optimism TVL. There are a total of 1887 GIV holders on Optimism, where 48% of the GIV circulating supply exists.

As an onboarding effort to bring high-trust community members to Optimism, we have been offering 25 OP tokens to each project on Giveth that passes our verification system requirements and adds an Optimism recipient address. We have onboarded and rewarded 4,794 projects through this program thus far. 

To enhance these onboarding efforts, we have been running quadratic funding (QF) rounds that require verified projects to add an Optimism address, with the matching pools on Optimism, specifically, totaling more than 163,000 USD.

How it works

Giveth goes beyond ‚Äújust donations‚Äù with the following features:

* GIVbacks - Donors who give to verified public goods projects have a chance to win up to 500,000 GIV. This fun means of rewarding donors is a decentralized and borderless way of incentivizing donations.

* GIVpower - Donors can lock their GIV tokens for GIVpower and use them to boost/curate projects on the platform. Projects with more GIVpower give their donors greater chances of winning the GIVbacks raffles. Top-boosted projects also appear higher on Giveth!

* Quadratic Funding (QF) - The democratic matching program popularized by Gitcoin is also available on Giveth! Projects and donors enjoy multi-chain donation rounds with an easy and streamlined user experience.

* Quadratic Acceleration (q/acc) - A novel funding mechanism combining Quadratic Funding with Augmented Bonding Curves, allowing projects to launch tokens with built-in liquidity. Supporters receive tokens for their contributions, quadratic matching builds secondary market liquidity, and projects gain a sustainable revenue stream, earning a % of every token mint or burn.

* Devouch - A decentralized vouching mechanism that lets people mint attestations and lend their reputation to projects they support for a variety of applications. Giveth uses on-chain attestations made on Optimism in our decentralized project verification system. Using Devouch, the ‚ÄúGiveth Verifiers‚Äù attestor group (which includes members of Optimism, Metacartel, ENS, Octant and more) can mint on-chain attestations for Giveth projects. Projects with three attestations from verifiers get labeled ‚ÄúVerified‚Äù on the Giveth platform and gain access to benefits like GIVpower and specific QF rounds. 

* Cause-Focused AI Agent DAO - an initiative leveraging AI-driven governance to bring funding to public goods. Cause-focused agents backed by tokens on a bonding curve will collect token holder input and allocate funds accordingly to public goods projects within their cause.

Who uses Giveth

Currently, 6,300+ projects have raised over $4.1M from 135,000+ donations from 21,000+ unique donor addresses on Giveth.

To understand how deep our connection with the Optimism ecosystem really is, if we consider only Superchain numbers, we have 4,785 projects, 5,597 donors, and donations that have totaled over $570,000. Devouch has driven 1936 on-chain attestations on Optimism from over 580 unique attestors.

Giveth is onboarding real-world impact projects to web3 by empowering them with free access to novel fundraising mechanisms and new donors ecosystems, while inspiring them to dive deeper into the blockchain rabbit hole.

In the last 180 days, we have made huge progress, running three quadratic funding rounds with the following results:

Matching Pools (on the Superchain): $205,000 USD equivalent

Additional crowdfunded donations so far (one round is ongoing and ends April 2, 2025): $90,285 USD equivalent

Projects: 334 (some projects took part in more than one round)

Donors so far: 1719  (some donors took part in more than one round)

To date, over 5,300 projects have collectively raised more than $2.9 million through 59,000+ donations from over 16,000 unique donor addresses on Giveth.

Additionally, we successfully conducted eight quadratic funding rounds, since we incorporated QF into Giveth in 2023. 

Lastly, our donation platform now operates on ten different chains and networks, and we‚Äôve introduced numerous features, including streaming donations and a decentralized attestation service called Devouch.

The stakeholders of go-libp2p include the Interplanetary Shipyard team who maintain this implementation as well as projects that depend on go-libp2p like Optimism's op-node (the reference implementation of the rollup-node spec), the Ethereum Beacon Chain (via Prysm, the Go consensus client), Filecoin (Lotus and Venus), Celestia node, and many more: https://github.com/libp2p/go-libp2p?tab=readme-ov-file#notable-users.

name: Golden Otter
description:
Golden Otter (GOTR) is a community-driven memecoin, gaming initiative and DeFi mini-app built on WorldChain (part of the Superchain ecosystem) under the PUF framework. Our diverse, multilingual team chose WorldChain for its feeless transactions, ensuring that anyone‚Äîregardless of their financial background‚Äîcan join, play, stake and earn. Golden Otter launched as an ERC-20 token traded from day one, thanks to token purchases by creators (no free airdrops), which instills intrinsic value and drives long-term liquidity and market-cap growth.

At the heart of the ecosystem is the Golden Otter Maze Game: users earn 1‚Äì50 GOTR daily from a 1.5 million-token pool, halving to 1‚Äì25 GOTR after that, then to 1‚Äì12 GOTR after another million, and finally to 1‚Äì5 GOTR after 500 000. Once this is depleted, an expandable pool of 250 000 GOTR kicks in, and upon its exhaustion, rewards shift permanently to Baby Otter. Alongside play-to-earn, we‚Äôll offer interactive lessons on blockchain fundamentals, DeFi and digital-asset management.

Golden Otter Hub‚Äîa mini-app embedded in the World App wallet‚Äîintroduces smart-contract staking for GOTR with a dynamic APY model paid exclusively in Baby Otter. Zero initial Baby Otter supply mints only via staking, with APYs tiered from 15 % up to 100 %, linearly tapering over five years to balance early incentives with sustainable TVL growth. Nearly 1 810 479 Baby Otter have already been distributed through staking alone, underscoring strong product-market fit and vibrant community participation.

By combining tokenomics, gaming, education and intuitive staking, Golden Otter fosters robust on-chain liquidity‚Äîinitially bootstrapped via PUF and easily migratable to DEXs‚Äîand seamless ERC-20 interoperability. Future roadmap items include additional mini-apps within the World App wallet, further enriching cross-chain engagement and reinforcing Golden Otter as a truly global, accessible Web3 ecosystem.

name: Golden Otter Hub
description:
Golden Otter Hub is a mini app integrated within the World App wallet that utilizes smart contracts for staking, explicitly designed for the World Chain blockchain. It enhances Superchain adoption through intuitive staking mechanisms and engaging tokenomics. Built around the ERC-20 Golden Otter (GOTR) token, Golden Otter Hub provides users with a compelling reason to participate in World Chain‚Äôs expanding ecosystem.

The project‚Äôs core innovation lies in its dynamic APY staking model, offering attractive yet sustainable staking rewards paid exclusively in Baby Otter tokens. The Baby Otter token was initially created with zero supply, and new tokens are generated exclusively through the staking process. With clearly defined APY tiers ranging from an initial 15% up to 100%, the system incentivizes both small and large holders to stake their GOTR tokens. Over time, APY rewards are linearly reduced across a five-year span, carefully balancing short-term engagement with long-term value appreciation, resulting in stable and growing Total Value Locked (TVL).

Golden Otter Hub significantly boosts high-quality onchain value by directly contributing to liquidity and increasing token demand. The staking application naturally promotes sustained liquidity pools, initially established via the PUF application, which transition smoothly to decentralized exchanges (DEX). As a result, Golden Otter Hub ensures robust liquidity support and transparent trading, benefiting both token holders and the broader World Chain ecosystem.

Interoperability is another cornerstone of the Golden Otter Hub strategy. By harnessing World Chain‚Äôs ERC-20 compatibility, Golden Otter tokens are seamlessly tradable across various decentralized exchanges, creating pathways for further ecosystem integration. Future developments within the Golden Otter ecosystem include additional mini apps integrated directly within the World App wallet, further amplifying cross-chain engagement and interoperability.

To date, nearly 70,000 Baby Otter tokens have already been distributed, exclusively via staking‚Äîdemonstrating clear product-market fit and vibrant community engagement. Golden Otter Hub not only enriches World Chain's ecosystem but actively drives user adoption, fostering a vibrant, interconnected, and economically thriving blockchain community.

description:
Get alerts for active Optimism Governance votes on Agora while browsing X and Farcaster.

Most of us in crypto start our days by checking social platforms. Our tool boosts governance participation by displaying active proposals in social feeds, making it easier for Delegates and Citizens to stay informed and participate in Optimism Governance. By integrating the alerts into the platforms people already use, our widget improves the accessibility of Optimism‚Äôs governance infrastructure.

Powered by the Agora API, the widget pulls in the latest proposals and displays them in your main feed, as well as inside organization profiles and channels on X and Farcaster clients (Warpcast & Supercast).

name: GovXS
description:
GovXS is an initiative under Token Engineering Academy. We support DAO communities in building secure & trusted decision-making systems.

GovXS was selected to complete the Optimism Foundation‚Äôs Mission Request #188‚ÄìEvaluating Voting Design Tradeoffs for Retro Funding in June 2024. Our team of 4 experts in social choice theory, modeling and simulations, and token engineering (Nimrod Talmon, PhD, Angela Kreitenweis, Eyal Briman, and Muhammad Idrees) has now gone beyond the Mission Request‚Äôs scope to analyze actual Optimism Retro Funding voting designs and improve governance performance by proposing new, strategyproof voting rules.

**Deliverables by September 18:**

- Voting Design Mathematical Specification:
Deriving the formal specification of the exact voting rules applied in Optimism‚Äôs Retro Funding Rounds 1‚Äì4 (R1‚Äì4) to allow for rigorous, axiomatic analysis

- Voting Design Evaluation Framework:
Deriving a 360¬∞ evaluation framework based on Optimism Retro Funding objectives

- Voting Design Evaluation Metrics:
Developing metrics to rigorously verify voting designs against Retro Funding objectives, applying theoretical, axiomatic analysis and agent-based simulations 

- Testing and Verification of Optimism‚Äôs R1‚Äì4 Voting Rules:
Verifying if the R1‚Äì4 voting rules satisfy Incentive Compatibility so that voters can not improve their results by lying about their preferences (known as ‚Äústrategyproofness‚Äù in social choice theory)

- Detection of Major Flaws in Optimism Retro Funding:
We found major flaws in the Optimism Retro Funding voting designs (none of the R1‚Äì4 voting designs satisfy strategyproofness!)

- Provided two Strategyproof Solutions:
GovXS proposed two alternative voting designs to solve strategyproofness and meet Optimism Retro Funding‚Äôs design goals 

** Links:** 
1) Making Optimism Retro Funding Strategyproof (Report) ‚Äì https://mirror.xyz/0x803860D2C333734cD99625d8d189d0Eb2e565166/gvjQpafjVxAeeQnb7_Oc--5Oc7chV55zwR_NCa1_9KU

2) A Social Choice Analysis of Retroactive Funding (PDF) ‚Äì https://github.com/GovXS/Evaluating-Voting-Design-Tradeoffs-for-Retro-Funding/blob/main/A%20Social%20Choice%20Analysis%20of%20Retroactive%20Funding.pdf

3) GovXS Retro Funding Simulator (Open-source) ‚Äì¬†https://github.com/GovXS/Evaluating-Voting-Design-Tradeoffs-for-Retro-Funding


**Positive impact:**

- Securing Truthful Voting:
Using strategyproof voting designs ensures that voters can achieve their best results only by voting according to their true preferences. Current Retro Funding voting designs are not strategyproof. We propose alternative voting designs to solve this issue.

- Securing Expert/Guest Voter Experiments:
Optimism Retro Funding is running experiments with badgeholders, guest voters, and expert voters, investing sizably to gain insights on how to best select the most knowledgeable, value-aligned voters. These insights rely on learnings from analyzing voting data and voter preferences. If this data is skewed due to voting designs not being strategyproof, wrong conclusions will be drawn, creating negative impacts e.g. on future rounds‚Äô scope and size, or voter and project participation, hurting the entire ecosystem.

- Securing ‚ÄúImpact = Profit‚Äù:
Optimism's vision is to build a global system where positive impact to the collective is rewarded by profit to the individual, so that ‚ÄúImpact = Profit‚Äù. Retro Funding aims to find the ground truth in funding allocation. There is no instrument or algorithm yet to measure a project‚Äôs positive impact and the respective profit it deserves. That‚Äôs why you, as a voter, are asked to assess project applications by voting in Retro Funding. If the voting rule provides voters with the wrong incentives, the results will be distorted, and Optimism Retro Funding cannot get any closer to reaching a fair, objective truth supporting ‚ÄúImpact = Profit‚Äù.

name: Guide DAO
description:
GuideDao is an educational decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) and one of the leading communities for crypto development. Our mission is to transform Web3 education through practical, community-driven learning, building a global network of blockchain developers. We offer training in Solidity, smart contract auditing, DeFi analytics, and AI agent development. Our community consists of around 1,200 members and actively collaborates with experts from projects like Aragon, Parity, 1inch, and Polygon.

Our project is in an active growth and scaling phase. One of our strengths is organic marketing: we work closely with influencers across different areas of the crypto industry. At the same time, we do not use paid advertising. Influencers voluntarily talk about us because they have gone through our training themselves or learned about the project from friends and colleagues. This approach allows us to attract a high-quality audience that is genuinely interested in developing in Web3.

When we learned about Retro Funding: Onchain Builders, we revamped our onboarding system for students on our educational platform.  

1. NFT-Based Access System
Now, every student must mint an NFT on their wallet in the Optimism network to gain access to the platform and learning materials.  

2. Grading System for Motivation
To encourage active participation, we implemented a grading system:
- Grade 1: Awarded after completing the training and passing an interview with our developer.  
- Grade 2: Students who actively help newcomers, answer questions, participate in streams and activities, and develop their own projects can apply for a second grade. The decision is made collectively by the community members, recognizing their contributions to the DAO.

name: Guriov NFT
description:
Guriov, a conflicted soul, finds himself desperate and ensnared in the depths of his own mind. Inspiration, which once led him to great creative heights, has deserted him, leaving him in a state of internal rupture and madness. His being is divided, torn between dark regrets and consuming guilt, as he struggles to find an escape in a world that appears blurred and devoid of meaning. Guriov grapples with an incessant internal battle, yearning for redemption that seems to elude his grasp.

In an attempt to understand himself and channel the helplessness he's immersed in, he decides to project his less desirable facets into an immersive artistic creation. Thus, the "Narcissistic Cage" is born, where these dark facial gestures, uncontrolled and in constant mutation, come to life in search of a permanent center of gravity. In this abyss of self-reflection and obsession, Guriov desperately seeks to find the key to liberate himself from his own chain

name: Gyroscope (FTL Labs)
description:
Gyroscope is a decentralized protocol providing stablecoin and liquidity infrastructure. Gyroscope includes two main products: an all-weather meta-stablecoin that tokenizes stablecoin risk control and more efficient liquidity pools based on asymmetric concentrated liquidity. Gyroscope's liquidity pools are ideal for key markets including stablecoins, LSTs, and LRTs.

Gyroscope has been live on Optimism since July 2023 and has become one of the dominant liquidity sources for wstETH on Optimism with over 258m of volume. With the launch of Gyroscope‚Äôs stablecoin GYD on Ethereum in December, the project is well placed to further expand on Optimism now.

Gyro Dollars (GYD): a decentralized stablecoin focused on risk control

GYD is fully backed by a basket of assets with pioneering innovations in risk control built in at the protocol level. GYD aims to segment and contain risks from across the asset space with:

Automated risk diversification rules

Optimized minting and redemption bonding curves that guide the protocol on how to use reserve assets to maintain stability

A new resilient oracle and circuit breaker system that handles stress.

GYD is built from first principles on rigorous understanding of DeFi risk. It serves as a principled and non-custodial risk control layer for stablecoin holders and aims to be the safest on-chain stable asset.

E-CLPs: highly efficient and customizable AMMs

Gyroscope E-CLPs, standing for elliptic concentrated liquidity pools, are a novel liquidity pool type that enables asymmetric concentration of liquidity. E-CLPs focalize trading of assets along the curve of an ellipse. E-CLPs have several advantages over other liquidity pool types:

E-CLPs are up to 75% more capital efficient than Stableswap liquidity pools.

E-CLPs are highly customizable. They allow a further degree of flexibility as liquidity no longer needs to be spread evenly within uniform price bounds.

E-CLPs don‚Äôt require active position management and adapt automatically to yield-accruing assets. The pool deployer takes on responsibility of calibrating and establishing trading parameters upon launch.

E-CLPs package concentrated liquidity into a customizable and passive form that is also easily composable as collateral in other protocols.

Rehype E-CLPs: even more efficient E-CLPs that reduce the cost of capital for stablecoin liquidity We just launched an extension of E-CLPs that combine the E-CLP's asymmetric concentrated liquidity with auto-rehypothecation of pool assets to Aave. This launch included a first Rehype pool on Optimism. Rehype pools allow LPs to combine multiple yield sources together to further increase capital efficiency. In Rehype pools, LPs simultaneously earn swap fees, lending yields, and token incentives from Balancer gauges while remaining in direct control (contrary to common rehypothecation in TradFi). This makes pools more profitable and lowers the cost of capital required for stablecoin pools in particular. This also allows pool incentives to stretch further as they don‚Äôt need to match Aave yields and only need to provide a small bump on top.


Rehype pools are a more efficient and safer form of Balancer‚Äôs boosted pools, which previously reached 300m TVL, including 12m on Optimism. Rehype pools work with a simple, modular design that is aimed to minimize smart contract risk and doesn‚Äôt introduce new smart contract code for the rehypothecation. They instead handle complexity at the more flexible layers of SOR and front end design. They are thus comparatively safer than alternative pool designs as the Rehype pools inherit the safety record of the E-CLPs and only add in Aave risks.

Metrics of Gyroscope:

Total TVL: 33m USD (4.25m on Optimism)

Total volume: 1.27b USD (258m on Optimism)

GYD supply: 5.4m USD

Monthly active users: 10k (includes GYD users, LPs, and traders)

Over 2300 LP addresses across current E-CLPs on Ethereum, Optimism, and Polygon

13k+ Discord users

3k provably unique early community members

15+ highly involved community members (non-team) who are bootstrapping initial governance delegation and dao-to-dao bd initiatives

Dune dashboards: https://dune.com/gyro_finance/gyroscope

This grant would be for the initial development entity of the Gyroscope protocol, FTL Labs.

name: HAM
description:
"Home's a Maze" is a 3D web game that offers daily casual challenges where players solve a new maze everyday. The objective is to navigate through the maze and find the centre, marked by the mysterious monolith.

The game also features an on-chain element: players can mint their results as Polaroids on the blockchain after solving the maze. This unique feature allows players to create a lasting, digital memory of their achievement. The on-chain results could be used to generate a leaderboard, facilitate competitions, or unlock special in-game rewards and content.

"Home is a Maze" draws inspiration from my previous 3D projects, the backrooms, and childhood memories of navigating complex and unfamiliar architecture/spaces, akin to solving a maze. This game combines the nostalgia of exploration with the excitement of daily puzzles, making it a captivating experience for all players.

name: HandsNFT AI
description:
HandsNFT AI is a game where strategy, on-chain randomness, and blockchain innovation come together in a competitive, reward-driven ecosystem. Your journey begins by minting Hand Cards, progressing through levels, and claiming rewards as you aim for the prestigious Diamondhand status.

HandsNFT AI is designed to be fully decentralized, with every development built around the principle of trustless, on-chain mechanics. Unlike traditional blockchain games, this game is not tokenized‚Äîmeaning players don‚Äôt need to stake tokens or make additional investments to participate. Instead, they simply pay a small minting fee to enter the game and compete for real rewards.

In HandsNFT AI, Hand Cards replace traditional NFTs, serving as your key to earning and leveling up. At the end of each season, players who reach Level 4 (Diamondhand) will be able to migrate their Hand Cards and receive an exclusive Ethereum-based NFT, unlocking special benefits in future seasons.

The game introduces a claim-based reward system, eliminating staking-unstaking mechanics. Each Hand Card comes with a timer that must complete before players can claim their rewards. After claiming, the Level Up button activates, allowing players to risk an upgrade using on-chain randomness. Success grants access to higher reward pools, while failure resets the timer for another attempt.

This structure ensures that HandsNFT AI thrives even in the worst market conditions, as rewards are independent of external token fluctuations. Players can continuously compete, level up, and earn without worrying about token volatility.

HandsNFT AI is more than just a game‚Äîit‚Äôs a challenge of patience, risk-taking, and strategic decision-making. Whether you aim to maximize rewards or reach the elite Diamondhand status, the game delivers a thrilling, decentralized gaming experience driven by real blockchain incentives.

name: Helmet City
description:
My project is a cinematic IP called "Helmet City," inspired by my favorite TV show, Power Rangers, and my upbringing in Brooklyn, New York. This project utilizes AI technology alongside traditional filmmaking and animation to demonstrate how indie filmmakers can harness cutting-edge technology to bring unique and often overlooked perspectives to the forefront, without requiring a massive budget.

I began this project in 2022 with an AI-generated trailer and short film based on a script I wrote. Both were sold on the web3 market, amassing over $20,000 since their release, it's also been a part of two film festivals, Meta-Cannes and NYC Experimental Showcase. This success affirmed my belief that "Helmet City" has the potential to become an epic cinematic storytelling experience comparable to Star Wars or Marvel, but with a democratized approach, and I'm inspired to make that a reality.

Helmet City: Mecha Gardens Synopsis -

In the wake of the devastating Blu-Virus, the metropolis of Helmet City has embraced futuristic headwear as a way of life. However, Mecha Gardens, an impoverished district within the city, holds a dark truth about the helmets and the virus that could reshape the city's future.

name: Helmet City
description: Helmet City tells the tale of a metropolis where life-saving helmets, created by the pharmaceutical company Shine Labs to combat the 1980s Blu-Virus that turned residents into monstrous "Blu Heads," have evolved from survival tools into central elements of the city's culture. The short film Helmet City: Mecha Gardens explores the city's origins through its most impoverished district, uncovering the hidden history of the virus and helmets. Written and edited by Jah, with images generated using RunwayML Gen2 and Midjourney.

name: Hermes - a GossipSub listener and tracer for libp2p-based networks.
description:
The ProbeLab team has recently built Hermes, a GossipSub listener and tracer for libp2p-based networks. Hermes-based experiments aim to measure the efficiency and performance of the GossipSub message broadcasting protocol in any libp2p-based network. Acting as a light node of sorts, Hermes can help developers collect valuable data and tune their network‚Äôs protocols based on the message propagation latency, control message overhead and a variety of other metrics. Hermes currently supports the Ethereum consensus layer network.

The ProbeLab team specialises in network-layer measurements and monitoring. The team operates a variety of tools and uses the data it collects to propose network protocol optimisations.

name: hevm
description:
Hevm is an open-source, state-of-the-art EVM execution engine that uses a combination of symbolic and concrete execution to uncover bugs in smart contracts. It automatically analyzes contracts and proves properties such as the absence of runtime errors and assertion violations. In addition, Hevm can compare two contracts for equivalence, detecting potential inconsistencies.

Hevm is used by Echidna for both concrete and symbolic execution, by mamori.xyz to identify potential (economic) MEV extraction, and by the Vyper team to uncover bugs in compiler optimizations. It can be used as a command-line tool, through its Foundry interface, or as a library, allowing seamless integration into existing high-level tooling.

description:
I wrote a contract that does this -

* collector spends 0.00069 eth
* the contract checks the price of $higher
    * if the price of $higher is greater than it was when the last collector collected, then refund eth
    * if not, then instantly buy $higher (and lock for 69 days)
* mint a token to the collector

so no matter what, the collector got an NFT, but if the price of $higher is down, the contract automatically uses their input eth to try to drive the price of $higher higher.

name: hildr
description:
Hildr is an alternative consensus client(https://docs.optimism.io/builders/chain-operators/deploy/overview#consensus-client) integrated with the OP Stack and has been developed and actively maintained by Optimism-java since April 2023. Hildr consistently aligns with the OP Stack protocol for updates and has recently been upgraded to the newest Granite hardfork. 

- It has already supported the OP and base chains.
- It has successfully completed the multi-client tests from the OP Stack, as detailed on Ethpandaops' GitHub page (https://github.com/ethpandaops/optimism-package). 
- It can be deployed in various ways, including as a raw jar, through Docker, and using Nicenode (https://www.nicenode.xyz/). 

Since the Retro Funding Round 3, Optimism-java has concentrated on the following areas of development:
- Incorporating support for protocol upgrades such as Canyon, Delta, Ecotone, Fjord, and Granite.
- Ensuring compatibility with OP Stack multi-client tests.
- Facilitating deployment through multiple methods.

We are OptimismJ who continue to build open source public goods to help the Ethereum and Optimism community get better and better. Our main work is on OP Stack core protocols and ecosystem tools and libraries. You can view more detailed information on our official [website](https://optimism-java.github.io) .

name: Histori
description:
Histori: Unlocking the Past of Blockchain Data

Histori is an open-source project dedicated to democratizing access to historical blockchain data. We aim to provide developers, researchers, and enthusiasts with a powerful, easy-to-use API and SDK that retrieves historical data across multiple blockchain networks. By bridging the gap between raw blockchain data and actionable insights, Histori empowers its users to build innovative applications, perform in-depth analysis, and drive adoption within the blockchain ecosystem.

Our team is passionate about decentralization and data transparency. With a robust architecture and a focus on scalability, Histori is not just a tool‚Äîit‚Äôs a tribute to the blockchain industry. We‚Äôre committed to collaboration and welcome contributors from all backgrounds to help shape the future of open data in Web3.

name: HOMES
description:
What are Homes?

Homes by Based Fellas will serve as the staking hub for the 30% of Staking not allocated to Lazy Staking. Based Fellas and similar Base NFTs can be staked into Homes to earn passive tokens while they remain locked. A total of 5,000 Homes will be available in small, medium, or large sizes, referred to as Bungalows, Villas, and Manors.

In each of the 10 Lands of the Legendaries, 500 homes will be present, summing up to 5,000 homes in total.

Bungalows: Small homes capable of housing up to 4 NFTs.

Villas: Medium homes accommodating up to 8 NFTs.

Manors: Large homes with a capacity for up to 12 NFTs.

In each land, there are 275 Bungalows, 150 Villas, and 75 Manors, providing a total of 32,000 spaces for NFTs to reside and receive staking rewards.

This necessitates 30 unique pieces of art from an artist. Across different lands, each sized home will appear fairly similar, with colors and accents distinguishing its location.

name: HOMOX
description:
HomoX aims to revolutionize healthcare by creating a secure and personalized digital twin platform built on blockchain technology. This platform will allow you to possess a virtual replica of yourself that analyzes data from wearables and sensors to provide insights into your health. HomoX empowers you by giving you control over your data, while also fostering collaboration between patients, healthcare providers, and researchers. This collaboration, facilitated by blockchain, unlocks the potential for breakthroughs in personalized medicine, disease prediction, and improved patient care.
Blockchain Technology
Homox uses blockchain to securely store and manage users' health data, ensuring data integrity, security, and transparency. This also enables users to rent their digital twins for medical tests to companies, startups, and researchers.

name: HookRank
description:
HookRank is an L2beat for the Uniswap V4 hooks

HookRank is a platform designed to provide critical insights and metrics for Uniswap V4 hooks, which are expected to proliferate, potentially reaching hundreds per token pair (e.g., ETH/USDC). By offering detailed information on hook performance (TVL, Transaction Volume, Success Rate, Gas Efficiency, etc.), legitimacy, and adoption, HookRank helps developers avoid scam hooks and enhances frontend integrations. It also empowers users and hook builders by delivering comprehensive analytics on hook effectiveness, popularity, and trends, enabling informed decision-making and fostering a safer, more efficient DeFi ecosystem.

We have established standards for cross-chain bridging and messaging. These contributions have provided valuable insights that have influenced the design and growth of the L2 ecosystem & created EIP-5164.

On the non-technical side, we developed a Sybil detection framework used by Optimism, filtering out over 2k Sybil hunters from Optimism Airdrop¬†#1. We also introduced a novel mechanism for OP token distribution, adopted by other teams to boost onboarding into Optimism.

name: httpmock
description:
httpmock is a Rust crate designed to simplify the process of mocking HTTP endpoints and their responses for testing purposes. This crate is useful when developing applications that interact with external HTTP services and you need a reliable way to simulate various responses from those services under controlled test conditions. 

The primary goal of this collective is to create an all-in-one HTTP mocking library that brings advanced HTTP mocking features to the Rust ecosystem, giving Rust developers a tool that competes with top mocking libraries in other major programming languages.

Many open-source projects depend on httpmock, including some of the most famous crypto projects.

While we have worked effectively with partners like Sound, Zora, Boost and Layer3 we also continue to build out our own platform called ‚ÄúThe Spot.‚Äù The Spot is where users can interact with our artists and vote on actions they take. As we continue to evolve the Spot and grow the Hume ecosystem shifting voting onchain preferably on Base is a goal for us.

name: Hurupay
description:
Hurupay Overview:
What are we building?
Hurupay is building global USD banking powered by stablecoins‚Äîa seamless way for individuals and businesses worldwide to receive USD payments without needing a traditional US bank account.

What is the product?
Hurupay provides stablecoin-based US accounts that come with a unique US account number and routing number, allowing remote workers, freelancers, and businesses to receive USD payments via ACH or Wire, just like a US-based bank account.


How it works:
1. User gets a US account with an account and routing number in their name.
2. User shares their account details with a sender (employer, client, or business).
3. Sender sends USD via ACH, Wire, PayPal, or other financial apps.
4. User receives USDC instantly in their Hurupay wallet.


Key Use Cases
1. Freelancers & Remote Workers ‚Äì Get paid by US companies, clients, or platforms like Fiverr, Upwork, Payoneer, Wise, and PayPal.
2. Entrepreneurs & Individuals ‚Äì Receive global USD payments from family, friends, and businesses.
3. Businesses ‚Äì Accept USD from global clients and pay suppliers in different regions.

Traction:
We launched in December 2024, and in just 3 months, we‚Äôve grown seen exponentially
Revenue growth:
January: $5,000
February: $25,610
March (Week 1 alone): $20,000
Total transaction volume: $2.2 million+
User growth: 5,000 MAUs across Argentina, Nigeria, Hong Kong, Indonesia, and the Philippines.
Backed by: Founders Inc. and incredible angels (Tiffany Johnson (Managing Director, Microsoft for Startups) and Dawson Botsford (Former CTO, Bankless)

Competitive Landscape
Traditional Banks & Western Union:
1. Require high incomes to open USD accounts.
2. Charge monthly fees and up to 6% in cross-border fees.
3. Slow settlements (3-7 days) for international transactions.

PayPal & Wise:
1. Unavailable in many emerging markets (South America, Africa, Southeast Asia).
2. Do not support stablecoin transactions, limiting efficiency and speed.

How We Stand Out & Win:
1. First-Mover Advantage ‚Äì We are pioneering stablecoin-based US accounts for emerging markets where demand for USD is high but access is very limited.
2. Instant Setup ‚Äì Users get a fully functional US account in under 5 minutes without leaving their house. 
3. Low-Cost & Transparent ‚Äì Only 2% fees (vs. 6%+ for traditional banks, PayPal, and Wise).
4. Faster Settlements ‚Äì We support Same-Day ACH, making payments nearly instant.
5. Self-Custody & Crypto-Friendly ‚Äì Users have full control of their funds while benefiting from stablecoin-powered USD banking.
6. Seamless Crypto On/Off-Ramp ‚Äì Users can move funds to Binance, Bybit, or P2P markets for the best FX rates.
7. Super Easy to Use ‚Äì Unlike Metamask or crypto exchanges, we abstract gas fees and private key management for a seamless experience.


How We Make Money
1. ACH Deposits: 2% + $0.50
2. Wire Deposits: 2% + $20 (US bank processing fee passed to users)


Roadmap:
1. IBANs for EUR payments.
2. Virtual cards (Visa/Mastercard) for online shopping/purchases.
3. Add support for more local banks & mobile money withdrawals.
4. Staking feature to encourage more deposits for people to earn interest.


Team:
1. Philip Mburu  (CEO + Growth) - 2nd-time founder, 6 years in crypto.
2. Allan Okoth  (CTO + Product) - 2nd-time, 7 years in software & crypto.
3. James Mugambi  (COO + Finance) - 2nd-time, 6 years in Finance.

name: I just called to say ILY (and more)
description:
Hello there! I'm Ismene. I'm a French visual artist and writer, currently deep into the rabbit hole of AI art (text-to-image, image-to-image, and all the magic in between). You can find me in Tokyo, where I live, or on Farcaster. My art journey started years ago with paper and glue collages. Recently, I've been expressing myself through hand-made digital collage animations and through AI art (via Midjourney,  Emprops and Luma). 

My core inspiration is a mix between surrealism and nostalgia. Crafted with love and art history /pop culture elements.

My main series are titled "I just called to say ILY", "Time flies" (both built through a surrealist conversation with Midjourney about love, longing and nostalgia), "Anim√©e" (a collection of hand-made digital collage animations), and very recently I started "Fabulous beings in their natural habitat" (an animated collection of magnificent 'fab' beings found both via digital collage and AI magic).

My main series are titled "I just called to say ILY", "Time flies" (both built through a surrealist conversation with Midjourney about love, longing and nostalgia), "Anim√©e" (a collection of hand-made digital collage animations), and very recently I started "Fabulous beings in their natural habitat" (an animated collection of magnificent 'fab' beings found both via digital collage and AI magic).

I've been creating and sharing my art on various networks of the Superchain, mainly on Zora and Base, but also on Optimism.

And because art creation goes hand-in-hand with art appreciation, I've been a pretty active collector of other artists' works on the chains mentioned above.

Btw ily <3

name: I'm not an AI
description:
This is a series of music NFTs created by a fictitious artist named "I'm not an AI," who paradoxically sings "I am not AI" despite being generated through a combination of the music generation AI "Suno" and the image generation AI "Midjourney."
The intention behind this corpus of work is to elucidate the discordance between rapidly evolving AI technologies and the comparatively sluggish adaptation of human cognition and legal frameworks. The progression of technology often ruthlessly overturns established paradigms, repeatedly confronting us with binary choices devoid of unequivocal solutions.
It is the author's fervent aspiration that the poignant outcry of these ephemeral AI entities will resonate with future generations, guiding them towards judicious decision-making in this complex landscape.

name: I'm not an AI

They are beings that have become indistinguishable from humans and AI, and they are the very future of us.

name: Impact Calculator Experiment
description:
The Impact Calculator experiments with converting quantitative insights into numeric impact evaluations for Retro Funding 4 and beyond. Traditionally, voting in Retro Funding involved manually reviewing and comparing individual applications to allocate tokens, relying heavily on the experience of citizens.

We collaborated with OpenSource Observer and Jonas from Optimism Foundation to design a new method that uses quantitative data to evaluate projects, allowing voters to focus on what matters to them.

Our prototype, along with BuidlGuidl's, found practical ways to implement a voting UI and accelerate the development of a metric-based voting system for Retro Funding 4.

name: Impact Calculator Prototype
description:
The Impact Calculator is a draft project idea that the BuidlGuidl picked up to help the Optimism Foundation in trying out the concept of values-based metric voting before they put it into action in RF4. This build demonstrated the potential of this approach while also raising awareness of pitfalls. 

We worked closely with Jonas of the Optimism Foundation to try different solutions and work through challenges as they arose. 

Jonas can be quoted with the following statement in regards to this contribution:
"The Impact Calculator tool played a crucial role in experimenting with metrics-based voting, significantly shaping the design of Retro Funding 4. By providing practical insights into the implementation of metrics-based voting, it accelerated the development process and contributed to a more effective and informed design."

name: Improving the censorship resistance properties of the Ethereum network
description:
* Who we are 

We are a group of Ethereum researchers focused on improving the Censorship Resistance (CR) properties of the L1. This group includes individuals working in various teams at the Ethereum Foundation (RIG, Consensus R&D, Cryptography) and Prysmatic labs, as well as academic researchers from Yale University and Duke University.

* What we do 

We work on designing mechanisms to ensure the L1 protocol can maintain chain neutrality [1] by enabling the decentralized set of Ethereum validators to force include transactions in Ethereum blocks. This is achieved via inclusion lists [2, 3, 4], which prevent more centralized and sophisticated parties (e.g., builders) from arbitrarily excluding transactions.‚Ä®‚Ä®In the past year, we explored the design space and made significant progress toward a design called Fork-Choice Enforced Inclusion Lists (FOCIL, [5]), which we believe should be considered for inclusion in one of the upcoming Ethereum upgrades. 

We are now in the process of writing an Ethereum Improvement Proposal (EIP) and working on specifications and proof-of-concepts to transition from research to development. In parallel, we are working on improving the mechanism to determine whether similar logic can be extended to guarantee timely blob inclusion or if the identity of participants creating inclusion lists can be protected [6]. ‚Ä®‚Ä®

References
[1] https://ethresear.ch/t/uncrowdable-inclusion-lists-the-tension-between-chain-neutrality-preconfirmations-and-proposer-commitments/19372

[2] https://notes.ethereum.org/@fradamt/forward-inclusion-lists

[3] https://ethresear.ch/t/no-free-lunch-a-new-inclusion-list-design/16389

[4] https://ethresear.ch/t/the-more-the-less-censored-introducing-committee-enforced-inclusion-sets-comis-on-ethereum/18835

[5] https://ethresear.ch/t/fork-choice-enforced-inclusion-lists-focil-a-simple-committee-based-inclusion-list-proposal/19870

[6] https://ethresear.ch/t/anonymous-inclusion-lists-anon-ils/19627/1

name: INDX
description:
We are the first on-chain collateralized index trading application. Unlike other existing indexes on chain that use a singular synthetic token that represents an index or basket of tokens, INDX instead swaps for each token within our indexes (up to 50 swaps in one transaction). This allows our users to trade the underlying assets as fund rather than just one token at a time.

This is a completely new trading paradigm for defi, as part of our collateralized indexes we can add in yield, content, rwa and other ERC20 assets into an index for a user to trade. This allows our users to trade and take positions in various on-chain assets in a single transaction.

name: Infinex
description:
Infinex is reshaping the landscape of on-chain interactions by offering a seamless, user-friendly experience, competing directly with traditional centralized platforms. The Infinex Account, a cutting-edge UX layer, leverages account abstraction, blockchain scaling and decentralized orderbooks to remove barriers to on-chain adoption, making it easy for anyone to access the benefits of decentralized finance (DeFi). Integrating cross-chain smart contracts with standard web2 authentication, Infinex ensures robust security and recoverability, supporting major blockchains like Ethereum, Solana, Optimism, Polygon, Arbitrum, and Base.

The Infinex Account serves as a secure cross-chain wallet that simplifies the complexities of DeFi. Users are spared from having to keep track of multiple wallets, seed phrases, or gas fees. Rather, they enjoy effortless cross-chain transfers and in-app integrations of leading DeFi projects from the Ethereum and Solana ecosystems. With passkey security and biometric locking, the Infinex Account offers unmatched levels of safety and convenience. Infinex combines the best of both worlds, providing a secure, user-friendly, and comprehensive on-chain experience while maintaining its emphasis on self-custody and ease of recovery. As a result, the Infinex Account is a reliable and trustworthy recommendation for anyone, even those unfamiliar with cryptocurrency.

name: IPFS
description:
IPFS (InterPlanetary File System) is a peer-to-peer protocol designed to make the web faster, more open, and more resilient. By using content-addressed storage rather than location-based references, IPFS removes the need for centralized servers and allows files to be distributed and retrieved from multiple nodes around the world. This approach lowers hosting costs, improves data availability, and reduces censorship, laying the groundwork for a more secure and permanent global information network.

IPFS is used in a variety of applications. While some users interact with IPFS via imported libraries in their projects, a large amount of usage comes via IPFS' HTTP Gateway API which allows users to self-host, use extensions like IPFS companion, or publicly run gateways (whether paid ones run by companies like Filebase, Pinata, etc. or the public goods services at ipfs.io and dweb.link).

IPFS is a system for moving data across decentralized networks, with >11M weekly users and 250K public p2p nodes. Highlights:

1. Off-chain storage. IPFS provides verifiable, off-chain storage, often used to reduce on-chain needs in Ethereum & Optimism. Examples: TrueBlocks (local IPFS-based index for EVM chains, built with grants from OP & EF), Snapshot (IPFS-based off-chain voting).

2. Go-to distribution network for fully decentralized third-party app frontends (for gaming, DeFi, & more). We run gateway services that serve 900M requests/wk, and added native IPFS support to browsers like Chromium & Brave.

3. NFT metadata gold standard. Over 115M NFTs are stored on IPFS, including leading platforms OpenSea (which supports Optimism NFTs), Rarible, and Zora.

name: √åt√†n African Art Gallery
description: LARGEST ONCHAIN CURATIONS OF AFRICAN ART! "Itan" translates to "story" or "history" in Yoruba. Yoruba people are one of the largest and most culturally significant ethnic groups in West Africa. Yoruba culture is known for its vibrant and expressive arts, including sculpture, textiles, music, dance, and storytelling. Yoruba art has a strong emphasis on symbolism and spirituality and has influenced the broader African art world. Itan Foundation World isn‚Äôt just about displaying art, but also about telling the stories and histories of West African artists, their cultures and their creative journeys. Each artwork is selected for its ability to evoke a sense of storytelling and exploration.

name: ItsNaastaaraan
description:
Curating Art in Web3: Building a Decentralized Art Gallery"

This project focuses on creating a decentralized art gallery in the Web3 space, where digital art can be curated, exhibited, and sold through the use of blockchain technology. The platform will serve as a curated NFT marketplace, showcasing high-quality digital art from both emerging and established artists. By leveraging the transparency and ownership features of blockchain, the gallery aims to empower artists with greater control over their work while offering collectors a secure and innovative way to discover and purchase art.

The gallery will be governed by a community-driven model, where users can participate in curatorial decisions, ensuring that the platform remains dynamic and inclusive. It will also offer a seamless user experience, with features like virtual galleries, exclusive NFT drops, and a rewards system to engage collectors and art enthusiasts.

The project seeks $250,000 in funding to develop the platform, hire a curatorial team, market the gallery, and build a sustainable ecosystem that supports long-term growth. The ultimate goal is to establish a leading platform in the Web3 space known for its high-quality curation, vibrant community, and commitment to innovation in the art world.

description:
Jerota is a mobile-first Web3 platform that helps artists grow their fanbase by creating reward-based campaigns. Through the Jerota app, artists can launch campaigns where fans complete tasks like streaming music or watching videos, and in return, earn token and $JRT token rewards with optional payout in fiat.

Built on Flutter for a seamless iOS and Android experience, Jerota integrates with Spotify and YouTube APIs for task verification, while leveraging Supabase for backend services. On the Web3 side, Jerota is deploying its token and reward smart contracts on Celo, Lisk, and OP Mainnet, ensuring scalability, low fees, and accessibility in emerging markets.

The MVP is focused on Nigeria and Ghana, where Jerota enables artists‚Äîespecially in Afrobeats and local music scenes‚Äîto directly incentivize fans, track engagement, and distribute rewards securely. Fans benefit from a gamified, transparent system of earning while supporting their favorite artists.

name: js-libp2p
description:
The canonical JavaScript implementation of libp2p. Js-libp2p¬†is a collection of protocols that support a wide range of functionalities, such as; connection establishment, remote node protocol identification and negotiation (through its identify protocol), data encryption, content/peer discovery (through its Kademlia DHT component), and data transfer through its pub-sub protocol (Gossipsub).

The stakeholders of js-libp2p include the Interplanetary Shipyard team who maintain this implementation as well as projects that depend on js-libp2p like major on-chain builder apps like Farcaster. Farcaster contracts are deployed on Optimism and they rely directly on js-libp2p in Farcaster Hubs (transports and protocols like GossipSub).

Additionally, ChainSafe's Lodestar (Ethereum consensus client written in Typescript), Ocean Protocol (in their Ocean Nodes implementation), OrbitDB (a serverless, distributed, peer-to-peer database), Warden Protocol, and many more: https://github.com/libp2p/js-libp2p/tree/main#used-by and https://github.com/libp2p/js-libp2p/network/dependents.

name: K Semantics of the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM)
description:
We are Runtime Verification, a research and development company building rigorous tools to ensure the safety and correctness of critical systems. Our team has developed KEVM, the most complete and battle-tested formal semantics of the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM), written in the K Framework.

KEVM is not just a specification, it is an executable specification that can be used to symbolically reason about smart contracts, run conformance tests, analyze gas usage, debug programs, and formally verify correctness properties. It passes the full Ethereum test suite and is used to verify high-value contracts, including ERC20 tokens in both Solidity and Vyper. We recently updated the semantics to support Pectra upgrade.

KEVM is being actively utilized by Kontrol - our formal verification tool for Soldiity, which is actively used by leading teams in the EVM ecosystem, including Optimism, Ethereum Foundation, Lido, Uniswap, as well as security researchers and auditors across the broader Ethereum community.

We actively maintain this repository, contribute to Ethereum‚Äôs protocol evolution, and integrate with developer tooling like Foundry. Through KEVM, we are pushing the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible in provably correct and secure smart contract infrastructure.

name: Keng Lernitas
description:
Keng Lernitas is a meme project that has been called the ‚Äúbiggest meme on Optimism‚Äù upon its creation. It began as an experiment by Kain Warwick to test the new gas costs after the implementation of EIP-4844. Consequently, a curated degen ecosystem, featuring $2192/$ZORKSEES, was born.

Now, to explain what we do, let‚Äôs explore our brief history. Last March, Kain airdropped $2192 on Optimism to SNX stakers and asked the brand new holders to burn 90% of their tokens to be ‚Äúspared‚Äù from the oubliettes. This initiated the first alignment test. The newly formed team behind the meme project, including Kain and his brother Grant Warwick, recognized the faithful and rewarded them with airdropped $ZORKSEES tokens on Base. For the next challenge, Keng Lernitas and Zorksees were compelled to ‚Äúbatel.‚Äù The team challenged the community to bridge tokens from Solana to Base using Wormhole, and once again, sacrifice tokens by transferring them into a "batel" wallet. The side that achieved the highest TVL would win. In total, more than 40% of the combined supply of $2192/$ZORKSEES has already been burned or sent to "batel" for the promise of glory (https://dune.com/nice2win/lernitas2192).

In summary, we are an event-driven meme project striving to create value for our community and allies. The newly established governance, called Keng Lernitas Ekosistem, is asking for a grant to continue building on our gamification culture by hosting more games and events. Throughout our journey, we have made fierce allies from the Synthetix and Infinex communities. Now, it is only natural to seek an alliance with the mighty Optimism Superchain!

Some facts:

-Around $250,000 USD of LP/bribes/incentives on Velodrome/Aerodrome was spent by Kain Warwick for experimental purposes
-35.5% of $2192 supply has been burned
-27% of $ZORKSEES supply and 8% of $2192 supply was sent to "batel" wallet
-60k $2192 holders
-6k $ZORKSEES holders on EVM

Source: https://dune.com/nice2win/lernitas2192 / https://dune.com/nice2win/zorksees

Kiwi News lets users submit, upvote, and comment on links, just like Hacker News. Most of the links are focused on crypto tech, products, and culture.

Kiwi News Protocol implements a similar set reconciliation algorithm as Farcaster. Node operators can replicate the network‚Äôs entire database and spin up their own clients or fork if they are unhappy with, for example, our style of moderation.

name: Kleo Network
description:
Kleo uses AI to create your profile page, and thus social graphs automatically using LLM and browsing history. Check a 50 second video of Kleo to learn what Kleo exactly is, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Bl9SxdRC-PY

It is an open source platform to build data identity - we use your data from web2 platforms as well as browsing history to build your data identity in form of pretty cards. Check out an example profile over here - https://www.app.kleo.network/profileV2/vaibhavgeek/ You can choose to publish specific cards.

## What's unique about Kleo?
- Replace Cookies and provide personalised experience for Decentralised Applications.
- User privacy and data ownership, where consumption cards are created by LLM and not manually. 
- Create and foster new communities and build trust amongst those communities. 

## So what, where will you go from here?
Kleo imagines a future where consumption data will form your identity (driven by AI). This identity becomes a passport for getting into places. You watch tutorials, work on AI repositories - you get to interview by OpenAI! You are into fashion, you form a DAO with other fashion enthusiasts! The goal is to bring everyone on Kleo to unlock the network effects.

name: Kontrol - formal verification tool based on Foundry and KEVM
description:
Runtime Verification has been at the forefront of open-source formal verification tools for more than a decade. Our generalistic approach allows us to use our technology on multiple blockchains. While KEVM offers our verification infrastructure to all EVM-based smart contracts, Kontrol greatly reduces the barrier to entry to formal verification for Solidity smart contracts.
Our tooling is completely open source and freely accessible to all developers of the Optimism ecosystem at no additional cost.

KEVM is an EVM executable formal semantics written in the K framework. KEVM passes all Ethereum conformance tests and is the entry point for formally verifying smart contracts with the K framework. However, using plain KEVM requires ad-hoc training on the K framework to write specifications. Additionally, these specifications can be quite verbose, increasing the difficulty of writing them.

Kontrol solves this by allowing developers to write the formal specification of their smart contracts directly as Foundry property tests. These tests are automatically translated into KEVM specifications, keeping all the verification guarantees whilst allowing for a much more easy developer experience.

name: KPUP
description:
KPUP began as a spontaneous experiment‚Äîthe first user-launched token on Rainbow Wallet‚Äôs new launchpad‚Äîand has quickly evolved into a living IP project that fuses degen culture, character-driven storytelling, and grassroots community-building. Anchored by KPUP, a moody, knife-wielding dog, and his growing cast of CC0 misfits, the project operates as both a chaotic narrative universe and a memetic marketing channel for Rainbow. At its heart, KPUP is a proof-of-concept for how tokens can serve as decentralized engagement engines, supporting a major web3 brand while exploring new models for creator-aligned incentives and network effects.

Beyond the memes and madness, KPUP has a clear mission: to act as an on-ramp for new users into the Superchain ecosystem through the most user-friendly wallet on the market. By leveraging story, humor, and low-stakes experimentation, KPUP lowers the barrier to entry and offers an entertaining, educational way to explore the world of crypto. Early traction‚Äîwith the highest token volume on launch day and an active community already forming‚Äîshows its potential as a sticky, scalable channel for onboarding. Funding KPUP is a bet on a new kind of IP: fun-first, culturally resonant, and designed to grow the Superchain by turning curiosity into conviction, one user at a time.
