name: Revolutionizing Inheritance: Heir/es Protocol Powered by the OP Stack
description:
Hello Optimism Collective!

We are excited to introduce our project to this forward-thinking community. Our team is focused on transforming the traditional inheritance system by integrating AI and blockchain technology to create a seamless, secure, and cost-effective solution for managing estates and trusts. 

At the core of our mission is to empower individuals and their heirs by providing automated estate planning, dynamic trust management, and efficient digital asset distribution. Using AI, we streamline complex processes, reduce legal costs, and ensure transparency, while blockchain ensures fast, borderless, and secure payments.

We believe the future of inheritance is digital, and our platform makes it possible for heirs to receive their rightful assets with ease and trust. Whether through real-time updates, fraud prevention, or on-chain transactions, we are building a system that simplifies inheritance for both present and future generations.

We are eager to collaborate with the Optimism community and explore opportunities to build a better future for estate management.

name: RIG Ethereum Core Research
description:
The Robust Incentives Group is an Ethereum Foundation research team dedicated to the study of protocol mechanisms through the lens of game theory, mechanism design, crypto-economics, formal methods and data science. 

Over the past year, we have significantly contributed to a broad array of discussions on improving Ethereum‚Äôs core protocol, such as the decentralization of its staking set, its ability to enforce and defend its neutrality, as well as to preserve its security.

We briefly introduce our main research directions from the past year.

Censorship resistance. We are developing mechanisms to ensure the L1 protocol maintains chain neutrality by empowering Ethereum‚Äôs decentralized set of validators to enforce the inclusion of transactions in Ethereum blocks through inclusion lists (ILs). Over the past year, we have explored the design space and made significant progress towards a proposal called Fork-Choice Enforced Inclusion Lists (FOCIL), which we believe could be considered for inclusion in a future Ethereum upgrade. We have also collaborated with the Commit-Boost effort to develop out-of-protocol inclusion lists bridging the gap until a protocol solution is available.

Timing games. Nearly a year ago, we named and introduced the concept of timing games in a publication, describing how proposers have an incentive to wait until the last moment to propose their blocks in order to maximize MEV rewards. Since then, we have observed timing games occurring in practice and have been working on mitigation strategies to maintain consensus stability. Timing games were central to critical discussions by the Ethereum research and builder communities over the last year.

PBS. Our group has been at the forefront of PBS research for more than two years now. During the time period considered for this retroactive funding, we have deepened our understanding of the practice of PBS with research supporting EIP-7732 (‚ÄúEnshrined Proposer‚ÄìBuilder Separation‚Äù). We have also been active in exploring MEV burn mechanisms, as well as the newer idea of ‚ÄúAttester‚ÄìProposer Separation‚Äù, with posts and publications.

Staking economics. This group put forward the idea of rainbow staking dealing with an ever-changing staking landscape. It intends to embrace the heterogeneity of Ethereum's staking set and foresees different roles for different types of participants. Separately but related, this group has proposed changes to Ethereum's issuance policy in order to maintain a healthy staking level that is long-term sustainable. 

If any of this catches your attention, please take a look at rig.ethereum.org to find links to all resources.

name: roll-op
description:
roll-op is a script that makes it trivial for any developer to spin up an OP stack rollup, both for dev and production use.

The script lets you configure and run your own rollup by running only two or three commands. It uses a single well-documented config file.

Additionally, it supports EIP-4337 AA infrastructure (bundler + paymaster) and helps you automatically subsidize gas for transactions that match certain criteria.

Spinning a rollup on Sepolia is as simple as:

> git clone git@github.com:0xFableOrg/roll-op.git
> cd roll-op
> cp conf.toml.example conf.toml
# conf.toml: uncomment Sepolia section, add your keys & rpc
> ./rollop setup --yes
> ./rollop --preset=prod --conf=conf.toml l2

More info: https://twitter.com/norswap/status/1707188816455622899

It has most notably been used by Celestia as the official way to let people experiment with devnet OP stack rollups using Celestia as DA layer: https://x.com/JoshCStein/status/1816558353172300114

name: Rundler
description:
Overview
Rundler (Rust Bundler) is an ERC-4337 bundler implementation written in Rust. Rundler is designed to achieve high-performance and high-reliability in cloud deployments via a modular architecture.

Built, maintained, and used by Alchemy to push the limits of user experience on EVM chains via Account Abstraction.

Goals
Rundler is meant to power the ERC-4337 ecosystem with an implementation that users can rely on to scale to their needs while maintaining high reliability. As ERC-4337 is a nascent technology, Rundler strives to be on the bleeding edge of feature support and the team will be contributing to push the protocol forward.

Our goals with Rundler:

ERC-4337 Specification Compliance: Rundler strives to implement the full ERC-4337 specification and to maintain support as the specification changes and new onchain components are released. This includes new Entry Point contract support, support for the upcoming P2P mempool specification, support for alternative mempools, and more.
High Performance and Reliability: Rundler strives to power the most demanding workloads in cloud environments. Rust was chosen for its high performance and memory safety. Rundler's modular architecture lets providers choose to run the stateless components (RPC, builder) in a fully horizontally scalable manner connecting to the stateful components (mempool, p2p, event cache) via the network. Rundler's bundle builder is designed to be able to support the full gas throughput of the network it's building for.
Extendability/Chain Support: ERC-4337 is designed to support any EVM chain. However, different EVM supporting networks have different rules around how they support things like gas usage, gas fees, precompiles, etc. Rundler is designed to be extendable and easily adapted to support any EVM chain.
Modularity: Rundler is written in a modular manner, allowing its components to be run as a single integrated binary, or as a distributed system. Rundler also strives for its individual crates to be used to support future ERC-4337 tooling.


Currently is run in Alchemy's Cloud, Coinbase's Base team, and powers >70% of UOs in Ethereum and a vast majority of UOs in the Superchain.

name: SCENES by Sound of Fractures
description:
Rising UK-based electronic artist and producer Jamie Reddington (aka Sound of Fractures) announces his groundbreaking project, "Scenes.‚Äù The interactive album invites fans to contribute their favourite memories and photographs in response to each of the record‚Äôs songs, encouraging a lean-in, emotional connection that‚Äôs been lost in our passive streaming environment. It transforms passive listeners into co-creators. 

‚ÄúMusic isn't just about sound; it's about the memories and emotions they evoke. ‚ÄòScenes‚Äô is an effort to give a tangible form to this abstract connection and capture it in something we can recognise,‚Äù shares Reddington. ‚ÄúEach song and its accompanying ‚ÄòScenes‚Äô will populate a digital gallery ‚Äì an archive that's a living testament to how music interacts with life moments in today's social media-dominated era."

Over 300 listeners have contributed Scenes, embarking upon what fans are calling a ‚Äújourney through the rich tapestry of our inner worlds.‚Äù The BBC Radio-featured artist and web3 pioneer chooses one Scene to be each track‚Äôs primary artwork, and then all the personal moment submitted are encapsulated onchain as a digital collectables that forever links artist and listener. Scenes reaches into real world audiences and makes an emotional connection and invites them to consider what owning this digital artefact of the moment means to them (a function that only the blockchain can offer
). The project will be displayed as an interactive physical exhibition at the Future of Music Conference and other music festivals, offering an example of how to rethink creative releases and allowing people to collect the Scenes that resonate with them in IRL as the project goes on a physical tour.

Scenes comprises of 6 interactive rounds where the singles are presented to the audiences pre release so that when the song and its respective gallery goes love they have already formed an emoitnal bond and contributed. For each scene of the 6 scenes a limited music NFT (the song and Gif of all submissions) is released via Manifold and a the gallery collection goes live as a Zora collection displaying and recording all audience member submissions as individual pieces of artwork. This allow for different collector profiles to connect with the project: Those who want a limited song, those who want to own their Scene and those who discover Scene that resonates with them and want to collect it.

‚ÄúScenes‚Äù is Reddington‚Äôs most salient experiment to date. It builds upon a reputation based as much on championing music communities as his unique sonic signature, which blends elements of Jamie XX and Burial with found sounds like his daughter‚Äôs heartbeat.

Scenes aims to re-imagine the music album as an ongoing collaborative piece of performance art that explores the relationship between memories, music and our online selves to form an archive onchain of each contributors encapsulated experience.  

More about Sound of Fractures:
Jamie‚Äôs previous success, with tracks like the euphoric 'Real Friends‚Äô' and club-heavy 'Let Go, have showcased his distinctive synthesis of films, stories, and human emotions in his music. Sound of Fractures takes elements of Jamie XX and Burial and mixes it with found sounds, like his daughter‚Äôs heartbeat and day to day life to create a unique form of deeply emotional electronic music. This time, with "Scenes", he goes a step further, seeking to challenge the traditional album format. Instead of offering passive consumption, he sparks an active dialogue with listeners by intertwining personal stories and music. Through this new project listeners are not just passive consumers but active collaborators.  The concept of world-building is central to Jamie's vision. In an era where music has become commodified, and artist identities often diluted, Sound of Fractures offers an alternative. ‚ÄúWorld Building is forging these connections that create strong emotional bonds around an artist's music. In today's digital life, music isn't just a product; it's an entire world that fans should desire to engage with, to be part of," Jamie articulates.
With the fusion of web2 and web3, as previously seen in his 'IRL' EP, Jamie is no stranger to the frontier of the digital and physical crossovers. His exploration of how to re-think music releases has not only positioned him as a pioneer but has also showcased the potential of new technology in building artist-audience relationships without big tech gatekeepers. As Jamie succinctly puts it, "Web3 isn't an 'or'; it's an 'and, a tool‚Äô'. A new dimension of creative freedom. It's about breaking the mold, starting new conversations, and forging genuine relationships with our fans. The future for independent artists is uncertain, but we can keep experimenting and find new approaches that bring more value to both musicians and fans". While building a strong community across his socials by challenging the current narratives of music careers, the Scenes project offers creators a real world example of how things can be done differently.

name: Scoop
description:
Scoop is an iOS game that lets you bet on the growth of your friends on farcaster.

Every profile is turned into a collection of cards and the price of the cards is determined by a bonding curve.

Every time a card is bought or sold, a 4% transaction fee is taken and added to a community pool.

At the end of everyday, creators on Farcaster are ranked by their engagement score (likes, new follows etc). The owners of the top ranking cards receive rewards (proportional to their ownership) from the community pool ‚Äî the better your creator does on farcaster, the more you earn.

Farcaster creators earn a cut of every trade that happens on their profile.

name: Scoop3
description:
Scoop3 is an onchain podcast player built on the Degen network which is under the Base chain. I believe we are the first crypto media app operating on an L3. We opted for an L3 because of the minuscule minting fees which we think are going to be necessary to scale. 
Podcast listeners want to signal their fandom, and they can do so by listening to podcasts, and getting an NFT of the podcast they just listened to. On the other side of the equation, podcasters want to know who their fans are and be able to recognize them (however they want), and podcast NFTs allow them to do that.
Essentially, we are bringing fans and creators are closer together. 

Couple notes:
* We have a patent-pending process which tokenizes media seamlessly, so the podcaster does NOT have to be crypto savvy to use the platform. This is our secret sauce.
* We DO have a working app currently on Testflight that our angel investors are using. We will be rolling it out to more people in the near future.

name: SEEDS / R00TMATRIX
description:
SEEDS is a cc0 music samples project that started on main net in 2022. It has moved to Base with vol. 5 this spring and I've added a interoperable/extensible metadata contract called R00TMATRIX that turns the project into an open music protocol on Base.

SEEDS music is open for anyone to use and many songs/beats/etc get made and sent to me on a regular basis having been created from them in one way or another. 

But building onchain unlocks new mediums and new methods of collaboration. R00TMATRIX protocolizes the SEEDS project into an open onchain database that programaticly delivers key/tempo/etc across SEED numbers, static versions (open to other musician collaborators) and dynamic & programatic algos of those versions.

Dynamic returns a version that's controlled by me at random or on a whim and can become an extensible contract.

Creative versions are contracts available to be made by anyone that programaticly select versions for each SEED number.

Right now there are about 40 SEEDS compositions created and the number will keep going up indefinitely. Now that one dimensional line becomes a 2D array as more folks make their own versions and then n-dimensional as Creative Version contracts are made.

Funding for SEEDS goes mostly into a treasury but has not been very profitable yet. But I have tons of faith in the project and keep making more and building with it as much as possible. It's been the first element it what I'm calling the Open Music ecosystem, where open collaboration through CC0 brings back remix culture in a positive sum way.

name: Self-Serve Developer Ranking platform
description:
[WHAT WE DID]

This web app https://devrankings.openrank.com/ enables any community or project to create your own Developer and Github repository rankings, using Github developer activity graph. The GitHub data is public from by Open Source Observer. The ranking and reputation compute is permissionless and verifiable, powered by OpenRank Protocol. Communities can leverage this tool to generate developer and repo reputation scores given their own seed trust. 

This tool helps everyone to have a quick understanding of how the developer and repo reputation scores are generated, through the step-by-step process of selecting ranking criteria, seed trust peers, and strength of seed trust peers‚Äô opinion influencing the reputation score of the rest of the peers. 

[OUR IMPACT]

The web app is powered by a graph of relevant GitHub event data from Open Source Observer, covering more than 2,000 organizations and over 30,000 code repositories, was employed in generating these scores. We established two kinds of peers: GitHub users and repositories. We then used a variation of EigenTrust, the Hubs and Authorities algorithm, which computes rankings on an asymmetric bipartite trust graph. 

The web app made it possible to generate client-side compute results, and replicate the same computation used in Retro 5, therefore it also serves as an educational and accountability tool for Optimism collective to better understand the governance metrics and algos used in a verifiable and transparent way. 

[WHAT IS OpenRank]

OpenRank is a decentralized ranking and reputation protocol. It enables a verifiable reputation compute layer for the open web that unlocks a broad range of useful applications, including those that resist cryptographic or game-theoretic mechanisms of trust. Using graph compute algorithms like EigenTrust, it offers resilience from sybil contexts, provides scalable and context-specific compute, and enables permissionless access to compute and reputation data for any user.

name: Settle In
description:
'Settle In' is a special track of mine and the first track I've ever deployed on Base! I initially wrote and recorded to this beat produced by Stoic a couple of months ago before passing it over to my good friend Nat Gem, who I met during my time at the University of Arizona. Nat took some time to brainstorm what his feature would look like. I envisioned some background vocals through the chorus/hook and knew he could whip up something dope. Alongside the background vocals, Nat laid down an epic verse starting at 2:45 of the track.

Nat came down to Tucson from Phoenix, which is about two hours apart. We planned a studio session at OCF Studios here in town and had a lively session with producer & engineer wizard Cecilia. I'm really happy with how this track came out; it's like a fusion of Alternative/Hip-Hop and is laid back yet captivating.

This track and its lyrics evoke a blend of introspection, uncertainty, and a willingness to navigate through the complexities of life and relationships.

Being able to work with such a talented musician and artist like Nat Gem is something I will always be grateful for. Thank you to everyone who supports us on our musical journey. You can certainly expect more music from both of us in the near future!

description:
Shredding Sassy is a forward-looking brand built at the intersection of extreme sports and crypto culture. Founded in Portugal by three friends, our mission is to bring people together through headwear, collectibles, and real-world events, all powered by onchain identity. Our NFT collection is deployed using LayerZero‚Äôs omnichain technology, and over 5,700 of the 6,200 NFTs have already been bridged to Base, making it one of the most actively migrated omnichain collections across the Superchain.

SHAKA is a memecoin connected to the Shredding Sassy ecosystem, launched with a mission to spread love, peace, and positivity across the onchain world. To kickstart adoption, we airdropped $SHAKA to over 40,000 EVM wallets, successfully onboarding thousands of new users to the Superchain. Many of these users were interacting with Base for the first time. We partnered with LinkDrop to enable frictionless sending and claiming of $SHAKA before smart wallet wrapping was available through Coinbase.

In addition to digital campaigns, we activated the Superchain physically through events like our Loule SkateJam in Portugal. This event combined real-world action with onchain rewards and earned us first place in the "Unplugged" track of the Onchain Summer Buildathon. We are now expanding this hybrid event model internationally through our network of community ambassadors.

Our goal is to grow the Superchain by connecting real people with real products, moments, and culture. With Shredding Sassy and SHAKA, we are helping define what it means to build onchain with soul, accessibility, and lasting impact.

name: Shutter Network
description:
Shutter is a threshold encryption protocol with a wide variety of applications, including: malicious MEV prevention, censorship resistance, voting integrity, and gaming fairness.

Shielded Trading.

Shielded Trading is the main focus on Shutter Network, we aim to provide a solution for front-running prevention through transaction encryption using threshold cryptography-based distributed key generation (DKG). An encrypted mempool prevents the parts of MEV that are considered malicious (front-running, sandwich attacks) while leaving the distribution of the benign types of MEV (arbitrage, liquidations).

End users, especially from DEXs and DEFI, benefit the most from shielded mempools. It strikes the best balance between ensuring market efficiency and minimizing malicious MEV. In other words, users enjoy a higher degree of base layer neutrality leading to a) better and fairer prices on DEXs and DeFi protocols due to front-running protection and b) an additional censorship resistance layer.

An additional benefit is that the encrypted mempool adds base layer neutrality and ensures that the sequencer's role remains impartial, making it impossible for end users or regulators to accuse the sequencer or other involved parties of market manipulation. The encryption of the mempool obscures transaction details, preventing any party from manipulating or censoring transactions based on their content. Ensuring that the transaction order is free from interference and aligns with regulatory goals of maintaining fair and transparent market practices, potentially fostering a more cooperative relationship between blockchain networks and regulatory bodies. This minimizes regulatory threats; for example, the Markets in Crypto-Assets Regulation MICA could treat front running and other types of MEV as ‚Äúmarket abuse‚Äù (https://twitter.com/paddi_hansen/status/1795084797238256110)

Shutter performed a feasibility study for Front-running protection via shielded mempool for OP Stack using threshold encryption (https://gov.optimism.io/t/shutterized-optimism-an-encrypted-mempool-for-the-op-stack/) and we are currently developing a module for the OP Stack. We are also in talks with multiple L2s, RaaS (Rollops as a Service) and shared sequencer projects to integrate mempool/transaction encryption on their solutions and integrations. They have already announced a partnership with Espresso to introduce an encrypted mempool for the Espresso sequencer network.

Shielded Voting. 

Shutter protects DAO votes from manipulation by whales. Votes are encrypted when cast and revealed after the voting period ends.


Shielded Voting is integrated with Snapshot, it is currently used by 382 unique communities. It has protected over 2,330 proposals and 216,805 casted votes.

name: Shutterize Optimism SDK (SHOP SDK)
description:
shop-sdk is a custom ethersjs provider, that allows to send shutter encrypted ("shutterized") transactions on Shutter-Optimism.

Shutter-Optimism is an Optimism testnet, that provides a mechanism to include Shutter encrypted transactions.

Shutter is a distributed key generation (DKG) threshold encryption protocol, that enables applications and/or users to encrypt arbitrary data, commit the encrypted message (i.e. by sending it in a transaction) and have it revealed after a certain condition is met (i.e. once the position of the transaction in a future block is confirmed). Shutter's threshold decryption scheme, where a threshold of n out of m key holders ("keypers") need to release their decryption key share for successful reveal, enables an environment where censorship, by not releasing decryption keys, and collusion, by peeking into encrypted messages before the reveal condition was reached, become very unlikely.

In Shutter-Optimism this allows to build MEV-resistant applications.

The intention of shop-sdk is to make it as easy as possible to transform a traditional application, that could run on Optimism, into a MEV protected version running on Shutter-Optimism.

name: Simbolik - Solidity Debugger
description:
We are Runtime Verification, a team specializing in formal methods and blockchain security. Simbolik is the tool we developed in-house, a powerful Solidity debugger that combines traditional breakpoint debugging with symbolic execution, enabling developers to explore every possible execution path and uncover vulnerabilities with precision.

Available as a VSCode extension, Simbolik integrates seamlessly into existing workflows, offering breakpoint-style debugging, Solidity and EVM-level inspection, and formal verification capabilities. Adopted by organizations like Lido, Optimism, Ethereum Foundation, and others, Simbolik helps Superchain builders write more secure and reliable smart contracts.

name: Slice
description:
Slice is the onchain commerce protocol. We build infrastructure and web interfaces to enable smooth, fast and powerful onchain checkout experiences.

The Slice protocol has been operational on Ethereum Mainnet for over three years and on Base from July 2023. Since then we have processed over 40,000 transactions on Base, supporting online, on-frame and in-person checkout experiences for Coinbase, Optimism, and more than 2000 stores.

Over the past year Slice has powered multiple Coinbase installations at major events such as Art Basel, Eth Denver and Farcon, featuring projects like Base Cafe, Based Merch, Compass Coffee, Coinbase Pizza, and Girl Scouts Cookies. These initiatives, as well as the Onchain Summer shop, have been highly successful, significantly raising awareness of onchain commerce.

name: Slither
description:
Slither is a Solidity and Vyper static analysis framework written in Python3. 

It runs a suite of vulnerability detectors, prints visual information about contract details, and provides an API to easily write custom analyses. Slither enables developers to find vulnerabilities, enhance their code comprehension, and quickly prototype custom analyses.

Slither has been used for many years by both security engineers and developers to secure their smart contracts. 

By allowing developers to find the most common vulnerabilities on their smart contracts, Slither helps to improve the security of the Optimism ecosystem.

Slither has 90+ detectors, and works on both Solidity and Vyper. In addition it provides printers, helping to review quickly features of contracts. It's python API can also be used to leverage its inbuilt analysis for custom needs.

Slither can directly be run on a contract deployed on optimism, with `slither optim:0x..ADDRESS`

name: Slugs
description:
Slugs is an onchain URL shortener for your online presence, reflinks, bios, casts, NFTs and more.

The Slugs protocol is a public good URL shortener with a series of unique properties which can only exist under an onchain paradigm: immutable aliases, censorship-resistant registrations, permanent ownership, tokenization of aliases allowing trade-ability, and referrer fees enshrined into the protocol.

The protocol is supported by a smart contract deployed on Optimism Mainnet, and a frontend which acts as an interface to the protocol and as a resolver to redirect requests to the right URL.

name: SnakyCat
description:
SnakyCat: Redefining Gaming Through Fun, Ownership, and On-Chain Innovation

SnakyCat is more than a gaming platform‚Äîit's a gateway to a new era where players truly own their experiences. Through engaging gameplay and blockchain technology, we're building a vibrant community of gamers and creators who shape the future of decentralized gaming.

At SnakyCat, we're creating a (cat) world where gaming means both entertainment and empowerment. Players own their assets, compete with purpose, and contribute to the ecosystem. 

Our mission is simple: combine fun, innovation, and accessibility to welcome the next generation of Web3 users.

Here's what makes us unique:

Innovative Gameplay: We blend fun with competitive skill and social interaction. Thanks to Coinbase Smart Wallet integration, anyone can jump in‚Äîno crypto knowledge required.

Trust & Transparency: At SnakyCat, the community leads the way. We actively gather feedback and host focus groups to ensure players shape our platform's future. Transparency and trust guide everything we do

True Ownership: Players fully own their in-game assets as NFTs, with the freedom to trade, sell, or rent them.

We chose Base as our foundation because it mirrors our values as builders and innovators. Base's low fees, fast transactions, and robust developer support create the perfect environment for seamless, on-chain gaming. As proud Base builders, we're driving innovation in decentralized gaming and Web3 adoption.

SnakyCat is part of a larger mission to strengthen the Base builder community and inspire more projects to embrace on-chain innovation. By making blockchain gaming accessible to everyone, SnakyCat is bringing people closer to Web3's benefits. We believe gaming is the perfect gateway to introduce the next generation to Web3‚Äîand we're committed to making it fun, inclusive, and rewarding. With Optimism Retro Funding's support, we'll continue pushing the boundaries of decentralized gaming and drive meaningful Web3 adoption. LFB!

Introducing Snapbam Memecoin Rebalancer ‚Äì the easiest way to manage and grow your memecoin portfolio.

Batch Buy Across Chains: Buy multiple memecoins from different chains at once with a single click. No need to go to different platforms or handle separate transactions.
No Fees, Gasless Trading: Forget about paying gas fees. Snapbam covers all transaction costs so you can trade without extra charges.

Snapbam gives you all the tools to handle your memecoins, automate trades, and stay on top of the market‚Äîeffortlessly and without fees.

name: Snapshot
description:
Snapshot started as a voting platform designed to allow onchain organizations to vote easily without gas fees. Its strength lies in its flexibility and high customization, catering to the diverse needs of its users. This includes options for calculating users' voting power, selecting different voting mechanisms, and managing proposal and vote validation rules.

As the gas cost dropped with the maturity of L2s and the need for more decentralized and trustless voting grew, we developed Snapshot X, an onchain voting protocol. Unlike the original Snapshot, Snapshot X operates fully onchain using a set of modular smart contracts. This shift makes Snapshot censorship resistant, with onchain and cross-chain voting power computation and trustless execution, while keeping gas costs to the minimal extent possible.

name: Solady
description:
Solady is an open-source repository containing highly-optimized Solidity snippets. It offers efficient implementations of commonly-used libraries, such as MerkleProofLib, alongside cutting-edge features like LibZip.

By thoughtfully encapsulating low-level inline assembly within flexible APIs, Solady simplifies the process of writing clean and efficient Solidity code. More than just a library, Solady also serves as a learning resource and experimental laboratory for pioneering gas-optimization techniques.

Solady is used in the codebases of Optimism and Coinbase.

With respect to the OP stack, Solady contributes in the following ways:
- Provides a Solidity and JavaScript implementation of FastLZ compression algorithm, which is used for more accurate gas estimations in the Fjord upgrade. The JavaScript code is very minimal, allowing for it's easy translation into Go.
- Various other utilities such as bytecode proxies and string operations.

description:
Bytes tightly packed arrays' utility library for ethereum contracts written in Solidity.

The library lets you concatenate, slice and type cast bytes arrays both in memory and storage.

-----

The Solidity Bytes Arrays Utils library is a Solidity library I initially wrote 7+ years ago, when Solidity was in its initial days, to be able to handle dynamic bytes arrays through canonical functions like concatenation and slicing.

I have maintained the functional part of its code single-handedly over the years with help around documentation and ideation from a few other contributors.

This library has been used extensively over the years by some of the biggest projects in the space. Names like Aragon, Maker, Uniswap, Nomad, LayerZero, and, probably more importantly, Optimism, in its initial version.

(Not all projects forked the repo. You can find a big list of forks here: https://github.com/GNSPS/solidity-bytes-utils/forks, the rest can be found by either searching "BytesLib.sol" on Google or just searching for parts of the code itself on GitHub.)

name: Solodit
description:
What is it?
Solodit is an open-source, community-driven platform dedicated to improving web3 security. It aggregates over 8,000 smart contract vulnerability reports, bug bounty opportunities, and security audits from top firms like Cyfrin, OpenZeppelin and Trail of Bits, alongside contributions from individual researchers. Solodit not only aggregates this information but also makes it actionable, equipping developers and auditors with tools to prevent exploits and enhance the safety of dapps.

Why is it needed?
The web3 ecosystem is plagued by billions of dollars in losses due to security breaches in smart contracts and protocols. Despite the availability of security knowledge, it is fragmented across various platforms and reports, making it inaccessible to most developers and security teams. There are several problems that Solodit solves:

Knowledge Gap: Many teams deploy smart contracts without understanding past vulnerabilities, leading to repeat incidents.
Inefficiencies: Developers and auditors spend valuable time searching disparate sources for security insights.
Economic Impact: Preventable exploits undermine trust in web3, stalling adoption and investment.

By aggregating and structuring security data, Solodit enables proactive vulnerability management and risk mitigation in the Web3 ecosystem.

How is it unique?
Comprehensive Coverage: Aggregates findings from leading auditors and platforms, offering unmatched insights into vulnerabilities and bug bounties.
Actionable Insights: Goes beyond archiving reports by providing advanced search tools and tagging systems to contextualise risks and solutions.
Community-Driven Enhancements: Facilitates collaboration via ratings, tagging, and leaderboards that recognise top contributors, fostering a thriving security community.
Educational Resource: This site serves as a learning hub for developers and auditors, providing real-world case studies on blockchain security.

Solodit is a multipurpose tool designed to:
Mitigate Risk: Helps developers avoid known vulnerabilities, reducing the likelihood of exploits.
Promote Proactive Security: Enables protocols to adopt preventive measures by studying historical vulnerabilities.
Streamline Bug Bounties: Simplifies participation in bounty programs, encouraging more ethical hackers to contribute to ecosystem security.
Foster Skill Development: Supports auditors in honing their skills and staying updated on emerging threats.
Support Decision-Making: Assists protocols in evaluating auditors via its leaderboard, promoting accountability and quality audits.

Who is it for?
Developers: Seeking to secure their smart contracts and understand vulnerability trends.
Auditors: Looking to access a comprehensive repository of findings and showcase their expertise.
Whitehat Hackers: Interested in participating in bug bounty programs and contributing to web3 security.
Protocol P&E teams: Aiming to assess risks and prevent costly exploits.
Educators and Researchers: Teaching or studying blockchain security with real-world examples, e.g. Cyfrin Updraft. 

Still to come:
UI/UX redesign
Power Aderyn, static analysis support

name: Song A Day (editions)
description:
Hi! I'm Jonathan Mann, known as "The Song A Day Guy".

Starting this year, I've been experimenting with L2s on Optimism. For the first few months of the year, I was selling editions of each Song A Day on Sound.

Then, starting mid-February, my dev and I created a whole new flow:
The auction for each new Song A Day runs on Zora's chain. It's a modified GBM auction contract.
When I start the auction, the song is automatically minted on my 1155 Zora contract.
Anyone who bids on the song automatically gets an edition.
People can "subscribe" to the editions via Hypersub.
When the auction is over and a winner declared, then (and only then) do i mint the 1/1 mainnet NFT.

This has saved both me and my fans a ton on gas!

name: song.camp: mint your music
description:
We created song.camp as a chill place that puts music nft's first. Song.camp is a simple instance of Zora that allows users to post, mint and share music on Base. Its distinct features are that of a persistent music player that allows you to stream songs as you navigate around the site, as well as an incredibly simple Create flow that abstracts away all token parameters from the creator.

When a song is posted through our app, a new Zora contract on Base is automatically created under the hood with Token ID 1 as that song. A 30-day open edition mint priced at the Zora Mint Fee is also initiated. This allows musicians to simply upload their music, cover artwork, song name and hit create - that‚Äôs it! Our minimal UI‚Äôs design also allows the music and its cover artwork to have center stage. We‚Äôve created super sleek and simple standalone mint pages for each song, making it all about the music and cover art. Finally, our app has minting and commenting integrated natively, so don‚Äôt forget to $enjoy!

Code is open-source. Art is CC0.

Curated by a life-long birder, using images from DALL¬∑E 3 and audio from The Cornell Guide to Bird Sounds: United States and Canada (v2021).

name: SONGS
description:
SONGS is a tech layer for royalties assets to minimize music distribution costs and bring in retail liquidity.

One-liner
SONGS is the next-generation layer for the music industry.

‚∏ª

Problem

There is no universal standard for how a song should exist on the internet.
Without it, the industry stays fragmented, inefficient and opaque.
A ‚ÄúWrapped Song‚Äù standard would let all parties share the same metadata, automate revenue splits, and make royalties tradeable, unlocking liquidity for independent musicians, labels and investors.

Solution (short)

Put every step of music creation and distribution on-chain.
SONGS supplies a transparent ‚Äúlayer of truth‚Äù that routes each song through a standardized lifecycle, adds efficiency, and creates new incentives for artists, professionals and fans.

Summary

SONGS shortens the path from an idea to a released song. It keeps valuable parts of today‚Äôs model but streamlines them with lower costs and clear, shared data rails, letting artists and fans interact more directly.

‚∏ª

Project overview

Songs Protocol
	‚Ä¢	Transparent industry ledger where all song metadata is visible from creation through distribution.
	‚Ä¢	Automated profit splits for creators and stakeholders.
	‚Ä¢	Near-zero supply cost; higher net earnings for artists.
	‚Ä¢	Digital distribution rights are tokenised as SongShares, so anyone can invest in a track‚Äôs future income.
	‚Ä¢	Streaming revenue flows straight to SongShare holders via the SONGS Distributor (the protocol‚Äôs oracle that delivers songs to DSPs).

Songs App
	‚Ä¢	One click from idea to release on 40+ digital platforms (Spotify, YouTube Music, Apple Music, etc.).
	‚Ä¢	Automatic royalty payments.
	‚Ä¢	Artists can receive advances from fans or any other protocol user‚Äîsomething previously limited to labels.
	‚Ä¢	Fans can crowdfund and own a share of the music they love.

Third-party apps (built on Songs Protocol)
	‚Ä¢	Freelance marketplace where services are paid in SongShares.
	‚Ä¢	Secondary market for trading SongShares.
	‚Ä¢	Liquidity tools based on song earnings.
	‚Ä¢	Rental and lending of SongShares.

Documentation: https://songs-tools.notion.site/SONGS-Docs-4c810f16cc084c63a4f92d721d285af0

name: Sotafi
description:
RWA-Based Sourcing-to-End-User (Sotafi) Transparency Platform
Project Concept:
Develop a blockchain-based platform designed to bring transparency to the entire supply chain process, from sourcing raw materials to delivering the final product to the end user. By tokenizing real-world assets and utilizing blockchain technology, the platform ensures every step in the supply chain is transparent, verifiable, and immutable.

Key Features:

Tokenization of Assets:

Tokenize raw materials, components, and final products. Each token represents a real-world asset and carries information about its origin, ownership, and history.
Immutable Records:

Use blockchain to create an immutable ledger of transactions and movements of assets through the supply chain. This ensures that data cannot be altered, providing a reliable source of truth.
Enhanced Transparency:

Enable stakeholders to trace the entire journey of a product from its raw material stage to the end user. This can include details like sourcing, manufacturing processes, quality checks, and transportation.
Smart Contracts:

Implement smart contracts to automate and enforce agreements between parties. For example, payments can be automatically released once certain conditions are met, such as delivery confirmation or quality approval.
Consumer Trust:

Allow end users to verify the authenticity and history of products before purchase. This is particularly valuable for industries where product authenticity and quality are crucial, such as pharmaceuticals, luxury goods, and food.
Compliance and Reporting:

Facilitate compliance with regulatory requirements by providing transparent and auditable records. The platform can generate reports for regulatory bodies, ensuring all processes meet legal standards.
Efficient Dispute Resolution:

Reduce disputes by providing clear and transparent records of transactions and asset movements. In case of a dispute, stakeholders can refer to the blockchain records to resolve issues efficiently.
Sustainability Tracking:

Monitor and report on the sustainability of sourcing practices. Consumers can be assured that the products they purchase are sourced and manufactured in an environmentally friendly and ethical manner.
Integration with IoT:

Integrate with IoT devices to provide real-time tracking of assets. Sensors can update the blockchain with data on location, temperature, humidity, and other relevant conditions during transportation and storage.
User-Friendly Interface:

Develop an intuitive interface for various stakeholders, including suppliers, manufacturers, logistics providers, retailers, and consumers, making it easy to interact with the platform and access information.

With a vision to revolutionize social networks, we have redefined the way social value is measured and rewarded, creating a groundbreaking social value indicator. This indicator spans various Web3 participation dimensions, unveils a range of personality types, and leverages on-chain and off-chain data, simplifying the process of growing your online presence and fostering connections, ultimately benefiting content creators and consumers alike. Rather than competing with existing SocialFi projects, we position ourselves as a complementary aid, facilitating content creators' passive growth of their social network and helping non-content creators gain the recognition they deserve for their value. We pledge to reward everyone for their unique roles and contributions to the Web3 community.
For more information about our project, please go to our lightpaper:
https://soulcial-network.gitbook.io

Impact
We have deployed two types of contracts on OP mainnet. One is an NFT contract based on ERC-721, and the other is for NFT trading in the project (we call it Market Contract). And we have upgraded the market contract from V1 to V3 in past few months. Therefore, we have deployed four contracts in total on OP (please check in Contracts Section). The total number of TX onchain of all 4 contracts is over 13k.
Now we have over 10,000 users registered for the project and over 3,300 users have minted their SoulCast NFT on Optimism Mainnet. Our twitter followers are over 16k. And we have over 6800 members in our TG community. 

About Our Team
The core team of our project has previously worked together as colleagues at a leading blockchain company with for 5 years. We share a strong belief in the potential of Web3-based decentralized social graph to contribute towards building a more authentic and trustworthy infrastructure network.

name: Spector Release Campaign
description:
This summer I'm building a world around my latest single, Spector. The reason I am doing this is because I want to break from the "norm" of the music industry (i.e. focus on streaming, 6-week release schedule, once a song is out onto the next forget about the last). People only share the final product in music (ie: the song) but never the process behind it, why certain decisions were made, and how/why the song was made. 

For Spector, I'm sharing everything along the journey and minting them on Base. Not just the art but my thoughts and feelings as the song developed, also including rare artefacts created during the campaign that wouldn't normally be shared. This then gives collectors an insight into my process and procedures for releasing music. Target audience for the audio is fans of electronic music but by sharing the story of the release, the aim is to reach music fans globally regardless of musical genre preference. 

All the videos of the project are being minted on Zora as free + protocol rewards open edition mints. The song itself is minted on Sound as a free + protocol rewards open edition. This makes all aspects of the campaign collectible and accessible at an affordable price. 

This has been a fun experiment approaching a release campaign at a different angle and documenting the process onchain.

Every day brings a new track, and players can mint Race Result NFTs to immortalize their best laps, get on the leaderboard and earn points towards a season championship.

Speedtracer is free to play and doesn't require a wallet, but uses onchain mechanics for paid premium players and immutable incentive alignment between players, partners and the game developer. The project aims to onboard new crypto users through casual gaming and is working towards better serving these players through smoother wallet onboarding, cheaper premium play and more mainstream brand partners.

Speedtracer tracks are onchain SVG NFTs. Each track starts off as a generative artwork created by a Solidity algorithm. Track NFT owners can customize the shape and color theme, then place additional artwork around the track. We partner with other web3 projects to create branded tracks that partners use to engage their community and gain positive brand impressions.

name: Spellbook dex.trades
description:
# Introduction to dex.trades

dex.trades is a revolutionary component in our dbt-based data analytics project, designed to streamline the process of indexing and analyzing decentralized exchange (DEX) trading data across multiple blockchains.

## Key Innovation: Macro-based Architecture

The core strength of dex.trades lies in its innovative macro-based architecture. This approach offers a game-changing advantage:

- **Effortless Integration of New DEXes**: With our macro-based system, users can now easily index trades data from new DEXes with minimal effort. This dramatically reduces the time and complexity involved in expanding the project's coverage.

- **Standardization Across Platforms**: By utilizing macros like `uniswap_compatible_v2_trades`, we ensure a consistent data structure across different DEX platforms, simplifying analysis and comparison.

- **Rapid Deployment**: The macro approach allows for quick deployment of data models for new DEXes, accelerating the pace at which we can expand our data coverage.

## Other Notable Features:

1. **Multi-chain Support**: Covers various blockchains, enhancing cross-chain analysis capabilities.

2. **Modular Design**: Organized into base project-level spells, chain union spells, and sector union spells for maximum flexibility.

3. **Robust Testing**: Implements seed tests and data integrity checks to maintain high data quality.

4. **Community-driven**: Open for contributions, with clear guidelines for leveraging the macro system to add new sources.

dex.trades represents a significant leap forward in DEX data analytics, offering an unparalleled combination of ease of use, extensibility, and standardization. By simplifying the process of indexing new DEX data, we're empowering researchers and developers to gain deeper insights into the evolving landscape of decentralized trading.

description:
The Amplifiers are a decentralized contributor group supporting the growth and adoption of the Ampleforth ecosystem. Acting as protocol-native communicators, they translate the core values of AMPL, SPOT, and related primitives into narratives, content, and strategic outreach. Amplifiers operate across multiple tiers of involvement‚Äîfrom social amplification and user education to content creation, ecosystem integration, and governance participation. Their mission is to accelerate understanding and usage of decentralized, algorithmic money by coordinating bottom-up action across social, technical, and financial domains.

The purpose of this grant is to bridge SPOT‚Äîa low-volatility, non-rebasing asset backed by AMPL‚Äîto OP Superchain chains like Base, Unichain, Ink, and Zora, and to incentivize SPOT/stablecoin liquidity on native DEXs. This initiative aims to establish decentralized, emissionless monetary infrastructure while aligning user behavior with FORTH governance. It supports Optimism‚Äôs vision of sustainable, censorship-resistant, and programmable public goods infrastructure.

name: SpyderScan
description:
SpyderScan - Honeypot Detector for DeFi Due Diligence
A honeypot token is a token that allows users to buy it but cannot be exchanged for any other token. This means the token does not have any liquidity.

Solution
We have built a honeypot token detector that performs due diligence on behalf of users to check for potential honeypot properties.

The honeypot detector forks the mainnet and queries smart contracts of AMMs for the token queried by the user. When the simulation is run, parameters like:

Sell tax
Buy tax
Amount out
Reserves
are recorded.

We also take legacy data from the blockchain to verify if the transaction properties match. We get the pairs available for the token through Subgraphs that we have deployed and filter and simulate for pairs in question.

Honeypot Detection Criteria
A token qualifies as a honeypot if the following properties are detected:

Very high sell tax
If the amount_out for a quoted token does not match the simulation transfers
If the reserves for a token pair are too low
If there is no token pool
On-Chain Security Implementation
We provide an Oracle that is constantly updated with the honeypot status of a token, which can be used by other contracts like lending and borrowing platforms, flash loans, and aggregators. This prevents on-chain interactions with such tokens.

This Oracle can also track tokens that are not honeypots but have a high chance of reaching a very low reserve state, enabling quick notifications to balance funds.

name: Stack
description:
Stack is introducing loyalty points as an onchain primitive and building tools for managing points programs. Our mission is to help recognize and reward the relationships the matter.

Loyalty point programs have long played a role in consumer applications and businesses, supporting industries from gaming, to beauty, to food, and more. These programs encourage product usage and retention, as users are incentivized to earn points for certain behaviors and then redeem points for rewards.

Despite their value, loyalty programs remain out of reach for many organizations and teams. This is due to two key problems:
1. Cost - it's expensive and resource-intensive to setup and maintain a program of your own
2. Value - it's hard to offer rewards alone that your users will value

Blockchains help reduce the costs of creating and managing a loyalty program. Importantly, they also reduce the costs and time to execute partnerships across programs, where users can redeem points for special offers or convert them to points in another program, enabling the formation of networks of partners to share rewards with each other. 

Blockchains are a natural platform for points programs, with built-in accounting, security, and the promise of using smart contracts to enforce rules for redeeming points for tokens. More importantly, blockchains allow composability of points programs by enabling interoperability among providers. The same open composability that has allowed tokens to flourish will pertain to points, too. Since the points protocol runs on a public blockchain, brands can collaborate without encountering any intermediary.

name: Stake DAO
description:
Stake DAO is a Decentralized Finance protocol initiated in January 2021. It is focused on liquid staking of governance tokens with lock mechanisms (such as MAV, CRV, PENDLE, BAL or CAKE‚Ä¶). 

The protocol offers the following product suite:

Liquid Lockers: Liquid Lockers enable owners of governance tokens using veTokenomics to enjoy all the benefits of the locking process, without the trade-off of illiquidity, thanks to a liquid representation: sdToken, which provides liquidity when you wish to exit your position without waiting for the full duration of the lock.

Strategies: Strategies optimize the potential of Liquid Lockers. Each pool from integrated protocols with a gauge can have a corresponding strategy on Stake DAO. These strategies boost yields thanks to the veTokens owned by Liquid Lockers.

Votemarket: Votemarket allows users to engage and monetize their votes for token emissions across integrated protocols, by earning incentives offered by users who seek voting power towards a specific emission redirection, thus enhancing participation by adding an extra layer of incentives for protocol governance activities‚Äã.

For any inquiries, please reach the following people:
- Hubert (Telegram: @hubirb)
- Chago (Telegram: @chago0x)

name: Stakers Union: A collective of solo-stakers for the Ethereum network.
description:
The Union
We are solo-stakers on the Ethereum network. We have chosen to prioritize the health and decentralization of the Ethereum network over all else.

The Problem
Incentives for solo-stakers are dwindling. Liquid staking and restaking protocols and their associated liquid tokens drive many away from solo-staking.

The Solution
We are building a registry of interested solo-stakers to support their activities by securing stable incentives from ecosystem participants.

name: Start Mode : Summer 2024
description:
Start Mode began on Farcaster as my first channel, focusing on the appreciation and support for gaming, art, and culture through experiential projects. It is the beginning of bringing more diverse mindsets on the superchain to share/discuss game-inspired creativity and methodologies in the artistic process. 

To start, I developed my own art project for OnChain Summer 2024 on Zora via the Base Blockchain. "Start Mode: Summer 2024" is a diverse set of animated artworks that evolve into various character sets through machine learning. Each piece is unique and shows love for the past, present, and future of pixel art. The functionality of this collection is similar to the concept of Pokemon, with each animation minted evolving into the next one. I used RunwayML, Touch Designer, and Photomosh to help develop these surreal posthumanistic figures. 

As a result, it gained a lot of great traction within the community. As only 17 artworks exist in this collection, over 140 mints supported this collection.

It is the first step into Start Mode's world, and it brings more conversations around gaming, art, and diverse cultures together.

By bringing workshops and presentations onchain, we've ensured their immutability, free from political censorship, bans, or other restrictions.

name: Streaming Quadratic Funding
description:
Flow State is a streaming funding platform and builder collective. 

We build streaming allocation mechanisms for public goods teams and communities. Streams are the ultimate form of programmable money‚Äîcapital-efficient, composable, and capable. With streaming funding, web3 builders can make more, sustainable impact with less.

Our flagship product is Streaming Quadratic Funding (SQF). SQF is a novel implementation of quadratic funding (QF), the public goods funding mechanism introduced by Vitalik Buterin, Zoe Hitzig, & Glen Weyl.

As the name suggests, SQF is QF with a streaming architecture. Donations are structured as open-ended money flows rather than one-off transfers. An incrementally updated quadratic matching formula continuously allocates pool funds based on these streamed ‚Äúvotes.‚Äù SQF can be thought of as running a full quadratic matching round every block.

But SQF isn‚Äôt just a faster QF.

By eliminating time discontinuities of the periodic round, SQF becomes something different‚Äîcreating new dynamics for grantees, donors, and outcomes while maintaining QF‚Äôs core democratic principles and effectiveness.

SQF rounds can be open-ended or longer than practical for periodic rounds (with traditional QF, the matching pool is distributed only after the round ends). This shift relieves structural pressure to consolidate grantee discovery and donor/voter participation.

SQF grantees don't need to compete for donor mindshare during constrained voting periods the same way and can stay focused on their core missions.

The traditional periodic round structure also asks a lot of donors/voters. It‚Äôs difficult to make informed decisions across numerous and broad rounds. With SQF, there‚Äôs an opportunity for higher signal and sustained donor-grantee relationships that evolve naturally on the donor‚Äôs timeline.

SQF‚Äôs continuous model also provides more funding predictability for grantees. Funds streamed through an SQF pool immediately hit the grantee‚Äôs account with incremental shifts in receipts.

We've seen these advantages play out in our first partner round sponsored by Octant. In the 150+ days since we launched the round for graduates of Octant's Accelerator Program, we've allocated over 26 ETH to the builders. Multiple teams have indicated that SQF funding has sustained them through the launch of their products.

name: Summer Day
description:
The painting ‚ÄúSummer Day‚Äù by four-year-old Lena is filled with emotion and love. In the foreground, there is a brown tree standing against a backdrop of dark colors, creating a striking contrast with the bright, intense red sky. The central focus is a red figure, lovingly depicted by Lena as her father. Although simple in form, this figure radiates warmth and closeness, capturing the affection Lena feels for her dad.

Above the scene, a large, yellow sun spreads its rays across the sky, symbolizing the warmth and joy of a summer day. The entire painting bursts with energy and childlike imagination, showing a world through the eyes of a young artist, where both her father and summer hold a special place.

description:
Superbridge is a user friendly interface over the native bridge contracts for Superchain rollups. Deployed soon after the launch of Base in 2023, Superbridge has grown into one of the primary onboarding funnels for users into the Superchain. 

As of 27th May 2024, Superbridge has facilitated more than $200M in bridge volume between Ethereum Mainnet and Superchain rollups. Checkout our Dune dashboards for more on the numbers https://dune.com/alexbh/superbridge.

Our integration with Conduit (https://conduit.xyz) as a bridge partner has meant that hundreds of rollups (both testnet and mainnet) built with the OP Stack have access to a high quality bridge interface for free. 

Our integration with Supermigrate (https://supermigrate.xyz) has made it easy for token teams to get tokens bridge over to rollups. Via our custom token lists, newly migrated tokens are able to be listed on Superbridge in less than 24 hours after deployment - meaning teams can immediately start to drive volume to the Superchain.

description: Superchain Safe is a customized fork of Safe{Wallet}, purpose-built for seamless multisig treasury management across the Optimism Superchain ecosystem. name: Superchain Safe
description:
Safe (formerly Gnosis Safe) is the most secure and trusted smart-contract wallet available across 80+ EVM networks, with over $150B+ in total value locked (TVL). In addition to its widely-used multi-signature functionality, Safe‚Äôs modular architecture offers exceptional customization (e.g., native account abstraction support) and integration capabilities (such as direct connectivity with DApps and Protocols), making Safe not just a wallet, but a comprehensive platform for managing funds.

Superchain Safe is a platform that integrates Safe's solutions across 10+ networks within the Superchain ecosystem. It provides a unified interface for managing funds across all networks in one place. Protofire DAO manages and supports the Superchain Safe instance, continuously adding new networks and expanding its features, including Safe Apps, Modules, Guards, and Wallet Integrations.

Superchain Safe is crucial not only for end users - such as DAOs, DApps, Protocols, and Investors - but also for the entire ecosystem, as its components form an essential part of the infrastructure. Overall, Superchain Safe plays a key role in driving Superchain adoption, enhancing security and reliability, and increasing TVL across all Superchain networks.

name: Superchain Token Explorer
description:
Superchain Token Explorer is a real-time monitoring dashboard that tracks new token deployments across the entire Optimism Superchain ecosystem. It provides instant visibility into token launches, liquidity pool creation, and market activity across 7+ OP Stack chains.

Key Features:
- Multi-chain support: Base, Optimism, Mode, Zora, Fraxtal, World Chain, and Lisk
- Real-time token deployment detection
- Automated LP (Liquidity Pool) status monitoring for Uniswap V2/V3
- Direct blockchain explorer integration
- OP Stack chain filtering capabilities
- Clean, responsive UI with real-time updates
- Open source and free to use

The tool helps developers, traders, and researchers discover new opportunities across the Superchain by providing a unified view of token activity. It's particularly useful for identifying early-stage projects, monitoring chain-specific trends, and tracking liquidity movements across the ecosystem.

Built with Next.js 15, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS. Fully open-source under MIT license.

description:
Embracing Optimism rollup, SuperchainSynergyHub by Aaron Vick merges cutting-edge tech with art and community. Dive into Web3 innovations where blockchain's power extends beyond transactions to spark connections, creativity, and collective progress. For creatives venturing into the onchain ecosystem, the importance of tools that guarantee provenance, help with distribution, and provide a pleasant user experience (UX/UI) cannot be overstated. These tools are crucial for ensuring that artists and creators can effectively manage and distribute their work, maintain its authenticity, and engage with their audience in meaningful ways.

The ecosystem is being designed to create new landing spots for non-builders to empower creators and normal users with safe spaces to explore, learn, commune, and commerce.  Various initiatives are being developed to create monetization using AI/other tools in order to build a sustainable Hub.  However, not all channels and landing zones will be monetized to keep the public focus and not limit the overall reach.

Over time, these landing zones will be the defacto niche zones for those who have yet to come from X and other social platforms.

The mission is to stay social first.

name: Supercollector
description: An easy to use fully featured blockchain music marketplace. Supercollector pioneered the use of a robust ERC1155 standard (collaborated with Decent.xyz), to bring true multi-track fully artist-owned releases to web3. Featuring easy on-boarding for non-native fans with email wallets and card payment alongside unique stable pricing and a fan-focused unlimited edition model. The Supercollector storefront is a highly creative platform allowing artists to heavily customise their release and artist pages. Similarly collectors can customise their pages to showcase their music collection in a personal style. Supercollector just celebrated the 100 release mark a little over 12months from launching. We are a 2-person team with a small crew of invaluable advisors and supporters. Co-founder/design Tom Vek is an experienced recording artist alongside co-founder/developer Chris Hipgrave. We are based in the UK.

Our suite of tools includes a high-performance Rust-based compiler, a comprehensive JavaScript library for smart contract interactions, and a robust debugging tool tailored for onchain applications. Our mission is to empower builders by providing reliable, efficient, and interoperable tooling that simplifies the development process and accelerates the creation of innovative onchain applications.

name: Superfluid
description:
Superfluid is the leading asset streaming protocol that brings reward distributions like airstreams, vesting and team compensation to DAOs and crypto-native businesses worldwide.

The protocol has been live on Optimism since March 2022 and on Base since July 2023. It has been empowering developers with a crypto-native financial primitive, money streaming, and a modular smart contracts framework to build applications that leverage a formula-based balance and gasless, liquid, ongoing value transfer.

Over 49,394 streams have been started on Optimism and 644,584 on Base for a combined total volume of over $280M.

Superfluid is designed to minimize its TVL in favor of making assets available to sender or recipient at all times, minimizing funds locked in smart contracts. As such its impact is better measures in total volume transferred, number of total or active streams, total number of users and daily active users. When measuring the protocol activity it's important to not only rely on the on-chain transaction to smart contracts, but also on the the inner mechanics of the protocol (i.e. by evaluating the actions triggered via callData or by using the protocol subgraph).

On the alignment with Optimism and Retro Funding
- Superfluid is builder-centric. A developer tool with clear focus on onboarding more developers to build more apps. As such, it‚Äôs additive to Optimism‚Äôs own goals.
- Superfluid is supporting long term, real world use cases, like Salaries, Subscriptions, Memberships, Rentals, Airdrops, Grants distribution as well as entirely novel applications in DeFi, SocialFi and beyond.

Superfluid Protocol has been used by the Optimism Foundation to stream the RPGF3 & RF4 grants, and will be used again in the upcoming rounds, providing the rails for a seamless funds distribution.

The protocol has been designed around builders and developers, with a set of tools available for building, debugging and data retrieval that empower new applications development. Here you can see an overview of projects built on Superfluid that have added value (and usage) to the Optimism and Base networks: https://www.superfluid.finance/post/how-superfluid-protocol-is-empowering-onchain-builders

If you have any questions or would like to learn more about Superfluid, please reach out to mdali.eth on Warpcast or Twitter/X.

name: Surfy
description:
We're a team called Surfy, building a real-world Crypto Payment Network. 

Our goal is to expand the ecosystem by connecting merchants who want to accept payments in crypto, users who want to pay in crypto through our map, and rewarding all contributors with our token for their contributions to the expansion and improvement of the Crypto Payment Network. 

jesse(CEO) majored economics and have experience of working at investment firm, and VC(Softbank Ventures and Samsung Ventures). Boosik(CPO) is full-stack engineer who have experience of front-end, back-end, mobile application. And both are super-degen. 

We created an MVP to demonstrate the demo, and we have about 10 partner merchants in Seoul. We're about to start a closed beta next week. 

Our strongest weapon is the Social Fi part on BASE. When merchants register on our map, they will each issue a token in the form of a bonding curve (similar to Friend tech's Key). One of the important utilities of the Merchant token is farming our governance token and enabling chat features with merchants, and users will benefit as the merchants' transaction volume increases, so users will be able to bet on the growth of merchants through the Merchant token. With this strong social farming element, we expect to see some interesting interactions between merchant users.

name: SWaptorX
description:
SwaptorX is a next-generation decentralized exchange aggregator built directly on mainnet, designed for speed, transparency, and user control. Unlike traditional DEXs that only provide a single swap path, SwaptorX compares and displays multiple routes across different liquidity pools and protocols, showing users the estimated gas costs for each. Users can then choose either the most optimal path automatically or manually switch between routes.

The platform currently supports 500+ tokens with seamless ETH‚Äìtoken and token‚Äìtoken swaps, including multi-hop routing (v2, v3, and mixed paths). SwaptorX also integrates advanced approval options (single-transaction approval or unlimited approval) to provide a smoother user experience.

Our mission is to deliver an efficient, fair, and fully transparent swapping experience for users, while making decentralized trading more accessible to global audiences through multi-language UI and responsive design.

name: Swiss-Knife.xyz
description:
Swiss-Knife aggregates all the useful EVM tools in one place to ease developer experience while they are debugging or building new stuff.

List of Tools:
1. Explorer: Quickly view any address/ens or transaction across a variety explorers, in just a click!
2. Calldata: Decode any calldata, and view the parameters in a human-readable format, even without having the contract ABI.
3. Transact: Send custom bytes calldata to transact with any contract, or leave the address blank to deploy a new contract.
4. Converter: All the essential unit converters on one-page. Convert between:
  i. Ether, wei & gwei
  ii. Hexadecimal, decimal & binary
  iii. String or hex to keccack256 hash & 4 bytes selector
  iv. Hex to 32 bytes left-padded & right-padded values
5. Constants: Have frequently used constants at your fingertips, like Zero Address, Max Uint256, etc.
6. Epoch-Converter: Grab unix timestamp, get timestamp x minutes/hours/days in the future, or convert timestamp to human-readable format.
7. Storage-Slots: Query EIP-1967 slots or custom storage slot value of any contract.
8. Uniswap: Calculator to convert UniswapV3 tick to price for any token pair addresses.
9. Character Counter: Count the length of the input string. Also allows to select on the input text to only get the character count for the selection.
10. Contract Address: Determine the contract address which will get deployed by an address at a particular nonce

description: Anemale is an artistic project by two artists. In 2023, we created a collection called Symbolic Citees, inspired by generative art assembled layer by layer for visual and symbolic coherence. We have created more than 1850 Symbolic CITEES, drawing inspiration from cinema, history, science, technology, mythology, fantasy, video games, and certain artists that we particularly appreciate such as Yves Klein, Dali, Kenda, Cocteau, Burton, Chagall, Miyazaki, Matisse, Gericault, as well as collections like Squiggles, Fidenza or Autoglyph. The mint is currently in progress on Foundation, but we couldn't modify the mint price and ETH has doubled in price since the start of our project, so this collection was doomed to fail. However, thanks to Base, we have built an incredible community with over 8k followers on Warpcast. We have made incredible connections and set up a subscription on Hypersub, which allows our collectors to subscribe for 1 or several months. name: Synonym Finance
description:
Synonym is a cross-chain lending market that enables users to deposit on one chain and borrow against that collateral on another. All user actions are routed through the Synonym hub via Wormhole Messaging, meaning that all transactions and liquidations occur seamlessly across chains without the desynchronization risks that plague point to point models. 

With Synonym, users can deposit, lend, borrow and earn from anywhere. Synonym is currently in the process of expanding across the OP Stack and adding compelling new ecosystems, assets and strategies for users.

name: Synonym Finance
description:
Synonym is a universal cross-chain lending market for DeFi users across multiple ecosystems. We‚Äôre building the cross-chain lending and borrowing experience that users deserve, powered by the Wormhole cross-chain technology stack. Users can earn yield, borrow, repay and withdraw from any chain, all from a single unified interface. Our markets are truly cross-collateralized, meaning users can borrow on destination chains with source chain collateral, all without using other applications to wrap, unwrap and swap cross-chain assets. 

Deposit, earn, lend and borrow from anywhere. We're making chain boundaries a thing of the past. Synonym is currently deployed across multiple chains, including Optimism and Base. We operate on a unique hub and spoke architecture and plan on deploying even more spokes to OP Stack chains.

name: Synpress
description: Synpress is an end-to-end testing framework for web applications based on Cypress.io and Playwright, with support for MetaMask. It is a pioneering tool in web3 end-to-end testing with the potential to evolve into a decentralized network of test runners and continuous integration providers in the future. Synpress is easy to use, fully tested, and includes features such as MetaMask support, headless mode, integrated video recording, and many more. It is also blazingly-fast and extensible, with the ability to add custom commands and plugins. Synpress is already used by many open-source repositories.

name: SynStation
description:
Gm Optimism Collective! I'm Eugene, founder of SynStation ‚Äì the first AI-powered prediction market protocol built to revolutionize the global entertainment industry.
SynStation enables fans to predict outcomes across entertainment, generating valuable sentiment data while driving significant cross-chain liquidity. Our protocol bridges Web2 entertainment audiences (think K-pop's $10B market) with Web3 capabilities, directly supporting Optimism's vision for "$250M monthly cross-chain asset transfers."
Our breakthrough metrics speak volumes:
- 500√ó user growth in 5 weeks (20 ‚Üí 10,090 active users)
- $104,669 weekly trading volume
- 282,000 transactions in a single week
- $121.95 peak ARPU

What sets us apart? Our AI agents analyze entertainment data through a proprietary vector database, empowering users to make informed predictions while generating actionable insights for entertainment companies. This creates a flywheel effect: more predictions ‚Üí better data ‚Üí more value ‚Üí more users ‚Üí more cross-chain activity.

We're addressing a critical market failure: the disconnect between passionate fanbases and transparent IP valuation. By tokenizing fan engagement and enabling cross-chain liquidity through prediction markets, we're creating new economic opportunities for both creators and fans.

name: Syntax by Spectral Labs
description:
Syntax is a network of AI Agents that's ushering in the Onchain Agent Economy. Syntax allows users to create their own AI Agents, and providers creators access to a dedicated LLM fine-tuned for solidity, and a variety of plugins (tools) that can enable agents to take onchain actions, and dedicated agent wallets that agents can use to trade on behalf of the users.  Wondering what could you buidl? Consider this - "Hey Syntax, here's 1000 USDC, find me the most trending memecoin on farcaster every 24 hrs and buy 10 USDC worth of it on uniswap. Close all positions whenever there is a gain of more than 10%"

Syntax is built by Spectral Labs, which has raised more than $30M till date and is backed by top tier investors like Polychain Capital, Google's Gradient Ventures, Samsung NeXT, General Catalyst, etc.

name: Syntra
description:
Syntra is a delegate dashboard that simplifies DAO governance by streamlining drafting, decision-making, and management with calendar integration.

In the evolving world of decentralized governance, DAOs have become central to decision-making across Web3. Yet, for many delegates, the tools and processes available often feel fragmented, isolated, and hard to navigate. We‚Äôve experienced these challenges firsthand, not just as developers but as participants in various DAOs.

Syntra is a delegate dashboard born from this realization: governance doesn‚Äôt need an isolated tool‚Äîit requires an integrated solution focused on people, the ones driving these organizations forward.

Shift in Focus: From Tools to People

For too long, DAO tooling has been focused on solving specific issues‚Äîone tool for proposals, another for voting, and yet another for analytics. The result? A fragmented experience that leaves participants, both newcomers and experienced teams, struggling to piece together a coherent workflow.

Our Approach

We knew there had to be a better way, so we asked: What if we could give DAO participants a head start? What if we could streamline these processes, so they can focus on what really matters‚Äîmaking impactful decisions?. Our target user base varies from newcomers to professional delegates leading teams of 10+ members.

For newcomers: Syntra lowers the barriers to entry, making it easier to draft proposals, post comments, participate in discussions, vote, and analyze governance activity.
For professional organizations: It facilitates coordination and collaboration, providing role-based access and tracking tools to streamline internal processes.
By integrating many of the existing tools within the DAO ecosystem, we help delegates manage governance processes more efficiently, improving not just individual contributions but also team-based workflows.
